Calling feature of Salesken Appie (Associate/Agent Portal) Webapp allows associate/agent to make call to any possible lead.

WebApp calling or Internet calling (as referred as VoIP calls) allows users to call other people via their Computer. Salesken WebApp calling allows user(Agent) to call leads(customer) phone number. Salesken uses Twilio provider to achieve this functionality.
Agent’s organization should have app call enabled, which can be changed in superadmin portal under organization setting section.

As a part of a precheck, when agent login’s and is redirected to dashboard a mandatory precheck is made i.e. agent needs to have a valid manager and his callerId should be twilio verified. If either of them fails, agent is restricted to navigate to the calling page.
To initiate a call, valid twilio credentials should be configured at the organization level, which can be changed in superadmin portal under organization settings section.
Twilio’s setup file i.e. twilio.min.js which is basically a browser SDK setup file that is provided by twilio for browser SDK integrations.
Technical Aspects:The following tables will be used while creating a team.
Once a Salesken Associate logs into Appie system (Login Salesken), that user, on successful validation of all the prechecks can use the calling feature.
The page is sectioned into two parts → Dialer and agent assist.
Dialer Input: An input type element where agent enters To number (lead’s number). To number needs to be a valid number and the country code is must.
Dialpad: It is a platform to dial a number to make a call on selected number.
Call Button: Initiate call to To number from agent’s callerId.

Call Configurations: This section allows the agent to switch calling type between Internet(webapp) and phone(proxy). Also giving the agent the freedom to record or not record the call that he is placiing.
This section shows the real time cues which helps in agent to deliver his sales pitch more efficiently. For more info please refer - Cueing.

Twilio token is the access token that is generated using AccountSid, ApiKey, ApiSecret. For every twilio token we need to define the grant permission for the TWIML Application using ApplicationSid. Along with a unique identification key i.e. agent’s userId. Users can navigate account details in Twilio console as per the screen given below.

Twilio token needs twilio credentials which are being fetched at an organization level using organization Id. Twilio credentials are stored as json object in cdr_provider table, under the column name provider_auth_details.
Twilio token is built using twilio’ s helper library : AccessToken then converted to jwt format.
More Info on Twilio’s Access Token - ​https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/access-tokens

Dual tone multi frequency (DTMF) is a technology used with touch tone phones, best known to users as the sound made when pressing a number key. It signals the phone company that you want to make a call and sends a command to the switch.
Agents can use Salesken dialpad on the dialer page to use DTMF.
Salesken dialer allow users to use any company DTMF feature.
Salesken uses Twilio SDK to send DTMF code.
If Salesken users (Agent) calls any organization (Company) number so that user need to go through some steps using DTMF keys. e.g. customer care number etc.

A response xml is generated to tell the twilio device what to do when the webhook get’s called. The xml response has both To and From numbers. To number is the lead’s number and From number is thee agent’s callerId.
Call is being recorded for both legs (record-from-ringing-dual), which essentially allows dual channel recording from the moment ringing starts.
We can get several parameters from the twilio request object sent from Twilio server to our webhook:
Caller: Can get the unique identity i.e. userId, that was used to generate twilio token.
CallSid: We can get unique Twilio Call SID which is used to create task in table task.
Agent initiates the call from the Salesken web App with the help of Twilio SDK which is build on java script.
System check the network connectivity to initiate the call. System generate error if network is not available.
System validate the phone number with the help of PhoneValidator.
System check the provider of the user based on user details.
System initialise the Twilio instance to initiate the call.
Task will be created once call will be connected from the both side agent and customer.
System pass the callsid,toNumber,crmLeadId,crmObjectName and isGdpr value in the url with request parameter.
System fetch the mapped product and pipeline details with the help of user object.
System create lead if the lead is not present in the salesken database.
System create the entry into the task table once lead is created.
System update the integration_metadata table if crm details is provided .
What happened if user dial a landline number?, Does the calls get connected?

Click to dial feature allow users to calls to any valid lead number from different platform(CRM platforms) by the Salesken Dialer. Click to dial feature requires agent number, customer number and email to initiate the call.
Agent phone number should not be null or empty
customer phone number should not be null or empty
email of the agent should not be empty or null.
API Key should not be empty or null
Url should be look like: - http://whj.salesken.ai/mis/tata/proxy/make_call?agentNumber={agent number}&customerNumber={customer number}&email={agent email}
The following parameters required to triggering click to dial features.
agentNumber :-  Agent Phone Number which matches with salesken user phone number.
email :- Agent email which is exist in salesken
x-api-key: API Key for the crm as per their organisation configuration. Need to pass in header.
The click to dial uses the same procedure of the internet calls or proxy calls as per user organization configuration.
In the backend System validate all the parameter value is valid else it throws error saying {parameter name} is not valid.
In the backend, System check that the url contain multiple parameters for the click to dial features, It insert the url into third_party_call_log table and generate thirdPartyCallLogId.
System checks that the header Api should be valid else it send response as a invalid or null authorization .
Once the authorization completes system applies the validation on agent and customer phone number with the help of PhoneValidator.
System initiate the Proxy call once all validation completes and retrieve task id when call initiated.
System find callsid mapped with generated task from the proxy call.
System insert the data into integration_metadata  with call lead id and task id and update the data into third_party_call_log if thirdPartyCallLogId is not null.
System insert the callsid and call mode into callsid_mode table.

Inside Salesken, Proxy calls stand for phone to phone calls means Agent will initiates the call from the Salesken app (Web or Mobile) to the customer so that agent will receive the first call on his phone device. Once Agent will receive the call, customer has to receive the second call. In customer phone callee phone number will be Agent caller id. They can start communicate once both leg1(Agent) and leg2(Customer)  are connected in the same call.
Agent’s organization should have proxy call enabled, which can be changed in superadmin portal under organization setting section.

Once a Salesken Associate logs into Appie system (Login Salesken), that user, on successful validation of all the pre-checks can use the proxy calling feature. The Phone mode should be selected for the Proxy call.
Users needs to be select Phone mode for the proxy call features. Agents dial the customer (leads) number on the dialpad and press the call button.
The following tables will be used while making a proxy calls and create task.
Backend : In the backend Agent initiate the call from Appie system. Appie will trigger the comm(MIS) services to initiate proxy calls.
MIS service decide the provider of the user based on user id and make a task for it if calls placed successfully.
MIS services uses default dialer if user does not have provider details.
Agent initiates the call from the Salesken App and the System triggered the MIS (Comm) server to initiate the proxy call.
System check the proxy provider of the user based on user details passed to the MIS Service.
System uses user_sip table to find proxy provider of the user.
Based on the proxy provider System initiate the ProxyControllerFactory.
System fetch caller id and org id based on user either is third party or salesken user.
System initialise the Twilio instance for the call.
If and only if realtime enabled for the user organization setting then only System starts the steaming of the voice in bytes for speech to text functionality else System stop this feature.
System generate the steaming url if realtime enabled and create the Call instance of the Twilio to start the call.
If the task id already passed in user object and task is not null or -1 then System update the task table with all data else System insert the data into task table.
System insert the data into integration_metadata table if user lead details is valid from the user object and System update the Crm details by the task id.
System update the lead status while call is connected.

Interactive voice response or IVR is an automated business phone system feature that interacts with callers and redirect calls to automated voicemail as per their organization configuration. IVR calls act as an inbound calls.
Task will be created as per name - Inbound call From twilio-ivr.
For initialisation for IVR calls there are some parameters needs to be validated are given below
Caller id and callsid  should not be empty.
Customer phone number should not be null or empty.
Purchased number should be configured into the Asterisk server (SIP).
Mapping of users inside ivr_number_mapping table for the organization should  not be empty.

When the customer calls the IVR configured number by phone call. Calls will be redirect to the automated voice mail. Users need to enter key code using DTMF by his phone. Call process will be handled as per company IVR configuration.
Customer number will be fetched from the header “SipHeader_X-Ivr-Identity”.
For Initiating inbound calls system needs to generate XML response to tell the Twilio to act accordingly.
System needs to buy a number for the IVR. Salesken uses BSNL for Indian number and Twilio for US number.
Numbers needs to be configured into the Asterisk (Sip) server and generate a sip url for triggering.
System uses sip url to pass the detail to the Twilio.
Any customer calls that number the System pass the details to twilio with XML response to mapped url.
Once the calls get connected one action will be triggered based on customer DTMF code.
IVR works as per user organization configuration. System need callsid, caller id and customer phone number to initiate the calls.
If system found any Festive season is running then system redirect the calls to voice mail with predefined voice.
If system found the user working hour is over then system redirect the calls to voice mail with predefined voice.
If any mapping found on the ivr_number_mapping table then system generate xml response with mobile number mapped with user id and recording status call-back url for the IVR configuration .
Else system processes IVR as per their company configuration with the help of DTMF digits.
Once the calls disconnected either from system or user the recording call back url will be triggered and the call status will be updated into the Task table.
Inbound calls commonly known as incoming calls. It land directly on the agent phone.
Notification will come first in agent dashboard when inbound calls is triggering to the Agent mobile.
Task will be created as like Inbound call from Twilio.
For initialisation for inbound calls there are some parameters needs to be validated are given below
For the incoming calls number should be configured in Twilio.

If any customer calls that configured number(Caller id) for the incoming calls purchased from Twilio or BSNL one notification will be triggered into Agent Dashboard saying You are getting an incoming call from this number.
Agents will be getting an incoming call on his phone after notification arrive on Agent Dashboard.
For the incoming call System needs to generate a token for a logged in device.
System need Account id ,Application Sid, api Key and secret key to generate token.
System needs to allow incoming grant type for the incoming calls.
If any calls triggered those number which are configured for the agent in Twilio console. Twilio redirect the call to agent phone number as per XML generate to the twilio.
System needs to fetch from number , to number and callsid from the Webhooks url request.
System validate that any receiver number is mapped with any user id in the Salesken Database.
If the user found in the Salesken database, System fetch the user details and create the task for the incoming call else System triggered one error voice mail to the user.
System update the status of the task by task id if task has created.
System update the CRM details by the task id.
System generate the Notification for the incoming call to the agent dashboard or mobile.
Conversation Metrics by Time on Sales Manager Dashboard

This page displays the calls that agents have had with leads by accounting for the timings and the duration of each call. Sales managers can view what time of the day agents have called the leads and how long they have engaged with leads. Further this metrics is segmented into Call Connects by time and User wise Call Connects by time.
Conversation Metrics by time has four pages under its drop down,
Sales Managers can set the reports page to a specific date range by using the custom date range filter.
They can download the reports page by clicking on the “Download” button next to the date range filter of the page.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out the reports based on multiple requirements.
Duration Reports by time: In this page the reports are shown through HeatMap Chart, where all the calls are separated by its duration and Time ranges of when the sales rep/Agent has called the lead.
Time frames/Duration Range for calls are divided as,
6 min =< Duration < 9 min
Time Ranges are divided with an interval of two hours from 24 hours schedule (As shown in the image below),
Time ranges indicate the time when the agent had called the lead across 24 hours (day/night).
Duration reports by time page consists of a data table for the following HeatMap Chart that is presented.

User Wise Duration Reports by time: In this page the reports are produced w.r.t time ranges and agents/users. Sales Managers can analyse the agent’s tasks on when they are performing them, how many calls and how long they spend the time with those leads.
It shows the number of conversation agents have had in a particular time range and provides insights to the manager on when the agent is least productive and when they are engaged.
User wise Duration reports by time page consists of a data table for the following HeatMap Chart that is presented.
Call Connects by time: In this page the calls are segregated into three types of connections and are represented in the form of HeatMap Chart w.r.t the time ranges.
Sales managers can view call connections for each user and analyse the number of meaningful and quality connects w.r.t time ranges for each user/agent.
Conversation connects  	 (Duration >= 1 Sec)
Meaningful Connects    	 (Duration >= 1 Min)
Quality Connects	 (Analysed Conversation of Duration >= 1 Min)
Call Connects by time consist of a data table for the following HeatMap Chart that is presented.
User Wise Call Connects by time: In this page the call connects are produced w.r.t time ranges and agents/users. It gives the intensity of the calls made by the agents/users for given time ranges.
User wise Call Connects by time consist of a data table for the following HeatMap Chart that is presented.
Steps to go to Conversation metrics by time on Sales Manager Dashboard:
Click on the “Conversation Metrics by time” drop down arrow.
Select the page that needs to be opened (Duration Reports / User wise Duration Reports / Call Connects / User Wise Call Connects)
By Clicking on the metric the user will be redirected to the respective page.
Conversation metrics is a page that shows the call logs with respect to Duration and Call Connects. This page provides the dynamics of the calls made by the sales rep within the organisation.
Sales Managers can set the reports page to a specific date range by using the custom date range filter.
Conversation Metrics page is segmented into two parts,
Duration Reports: Produces the conversations log data separated with duration time frame w.r.t corresponding Agents.
Call Connects: Produces the calls with three different types of connections w.r.t corresponding Agents.
Duration Reports: In this page the reports are shown through the HeatMap Chart, where the calls are separated with Duration Range and Sales Reps.
On the chart it shows, Total Conversations from the Agents and these calls are separated w.r.t the duration range/time frame.
Duration reports page consists of a data table for the following HeatMap Chart that is presented.
Call Connects: In this page the calls are segregated into three types of connects and are represented in the form of HeatMap Chart w.r.t the agents/sales reps.
Quality Connects	 (Analyzed Conversation of Duration >= 1 Min)
Call Connects consist of a data table for the following HeatMap Chart that is presented.
Steps to go to Conversation Metrics page on Sales Manager Dashboard:
Click on the “Conversation Metrics” drop down arrow.
Select the page that needs to be opened (Duration Reports / Call Connects)
By Clicking on the metric  the user will be redirected to the respective page.

The Sales Manager can get a bird's eye perspective of how productive users and teams are throughout the organization by visiting the Productivity page. This is determined by comparing the number of conversations and the duration of those conversations among sales representatives, teams, or on the organization's day-by-day reporting.
Sales managers can download productivity reports within specific dates by using a custom date range filter on the page.
Sales Managers can download the Productivity report by clicking on the download button on the page.
Pipeline, Conversation type, Call type, Stages, Signals, Teams and  Sales reps.
Objective: To check the productivity across users, teams and day to day performance within the organisation.
This is accomplished by tracking the activities of sales representatives and their teams, contrasting them with the Count and Duration of conversations within a predetermined time frame.
Sales rep name/Team Name/Conversation Date (Depends on the type of report)
Handling Time (Total Call duration including ring time)

User Wise Productivity Report: It shows the graphical representation of users/sales reps with their conversation counts and duration on either axis. It displays the number of calls made by sales representatives across the organisation and the duration of those calls.
Sales Manager can customize this report by using the filter option and Date range  button on the top right corner.
Data table for User wise reports are given below,

Team Wise productivity Report: It shows the graphical representation of Teams in an organisation with their conversation counts and duration on either axis. It displays the number of calls made by teams within the organisation and the duration of those calls.
Data table for Team Wise Report are given below,

Day wise Velocity Report: It shows the graphical representation on productivity for day to day activities/tasks of the entire organisation. It displays the number of calls made by sales representatives across the organisation and the duration of those calls.
Data table for Day Wise velocity report is given below,
Steps to go to Productivity page on Sales Manager Dashboard:
Navigate to “Productivity” drop down and select the productivity page that needs to be opened.

Cue Adherence is a page that provides an overview for the sales managers on the cues that are detected and adhered by the sales reps. This is necessary as the sales manager can analyse if the cues that are uploaded for products are beneficial for the reps during their conversations with the leads.
Sales managers can filter out the cues within specific dates by using a custom date range filter on the page.
Objective: To observe if the cues that are uploaded for the products are being detected and adhered effectively by the sales rep/user during their conversation with the leads.
Cue Details: Cue values that were triggered during the conversation.
Cues Detected: Shows the number of Cues that were detected during conversation.
Cues Adhered: Shows the number of Cues that were detected and followed up/adhered by the sales rep.
User Details: Shows the User/sales rep details that are filtered by the manager.
Cues Detected: Shows the number of times the cues were detected through a particular sales rep/user in his conversation with the leads.
Cues Adhered: Shows the number of times the Sales rep/ User has adhered to the cues that were detected.
Steps to go to the Cue Adherence page on Sales Manager Dashboard:
Click on “Cue Adherence”, User will be directed to the Cue Adherence page of the Sales Manager Dashboard.

The sales managers can use this page to examine the relationship between the signal that must be observed and the signal that needs to be correlated. It provides the sales managers the ability to check if the signals have any relationship with each other and to what extent. This is represented using a HeatMap chart with signal to be observed in x - axis and Signal to correlate in y - axis.
Sales managers can filter out the signals within specific dates by using a custom date range filter on the page.
Objective: To check the relationship between two distinctive signals and to examine if there is any correlation between the two signals.
Steps to initiate correlation on Sales Manager Dashboard:
In order to start the correlation, the manager needs to select the signal to be observed from the filter option on the top right corner.
For this to work we need to at least add one “signal to observe” from filters.
Add at least one 'Signal to Correlate' to check the data against the first selection.
Add any other filters as required. Such as,
Steps to go to Correlation page on sales manager dashboard:
Click on “Correlation”, User will be directed to the correlation page of the Sales Manager Dashboard.
For the correlation done on the signals there will be a data table displayed under the HeatMap Chart. This table shows contents on,
Signal to observe, Total Number of calls, Signal to correlate ( Instance and coverage)
Instance: It shows the number of times the signals were captured.
Coverage: Shows the percentage of calls in which signal to be correlated and signal to be observed was caught.

The follow up page is viewed by the sales manager to check if the Sales reps are engaging with their leads and following up with their actions. Follow ups determine the number of times a sales rep has called a particular lead repeatedly.
This page provides a graphical representation of team members/ Sales reps w.r.t  average follow ups.
Sales Manager can sort the dashboard for follow ups with a custom date range filter.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out the data  based on multiple requirements.

Follow up on leads are very much necessary for sales rep as they can maintain the interest of the lead or improve the chance of them getting converted. Hence it is essential for the sales managers to supervise if the reps are following up the leads.
There is a data table present under the graph that gives information of each sales rep with their Team name, Average Follow ups, Handling time and Total Duration.(As shown in the image below)
Handling Time: Total call duration including ring time.
Steps to go to Follow Up page on sales manager dashboard:
Click on “Follow up”, User will be directed to the Follow Up page of the Sales Manager Dashboard.

Fonality is a dialer where reps can make or receive calls and Fonality stores all the call details made from its platform. Integration with Dialer allows you to connect all your call information to Salesken.
Integrate Fonality with Salesken to capture and analyze sales conversations. Collect all of your call recordings in Salesken to obtain transcripts and insights from every customer interaction.

Uploading of Bulk Signals for a Product on Salesken Super Admin Dashboard

These are the indications that are defined under a particular dimension that get captured when the customer or sales reps initiate during the conversation. These captured statements are known as signals. It's a required capturing point for each product during a sales call. Signals are basically aspects to look into when an agent is on a sales call with the lead. These signals are either manually provided by the organisation for their products or offered under "Suggestive Signals'' from the Salesken data science model. Depending on the conversation script that has been examined for each product, there may be various sets of signals for various products. Bulk signals are multiple signals that can be added at once for a product by the Super Admin.
Note: Set of signals/Bulk signals should be uploaded by selecting one product at a time. Super Admin cannot select multiple products and add bulk signals for all.

This option is very much needed for the super admin or the organisation as it allows Super Admin to add a whole set of signals for the product at once instead of adding them manually. This step reduces the time and effort required to put on each signal for a product manually on the dashboard.
Steps to upload bulk signals for a product on Super Admin Salesken Dashboard:
Login to the salesken Super Admin Dashboard.
Click On the “Organisation List” from the Top Menu toolbar.
Search the Organisation Name on the Search bar (under the “Create Organisation” button).
Click on the “Organisation Name”. For example: SBI Life
On the Report Page Click on the “Product  List” from the Top Menu toolbar.
Select the product for which you need to upload Bulk Signals for, (In case of multiple products) using the drop down.
Select the “Default Product” (In case of only one Product)
(If only one product is available it takes as “Default Product”)

Any supporting documents for the Bulk Signals can be added by clicking on the “Drop files here or click to upload” section of the page. You can also drag and drop a file from your system into this section.
The document should consist of Signal Name, Signal Value, Speaker, Duration Constraint and Category. File Type should be (.xlsx)
( Refer the image below for reference)
Now the User has uploaded the bulk signals of a specific product for your organisation.
Uploading of Bulk Signals for a Product on Super Admin
Uploading of Bulk Cues for a product on salesken Super Admin Dashboard

Cues are prompts that the salesken dashboard provides to sales representatives as they are speaking with customers in real time. It provides cues for sales representatives regarding what to say or do in order to engage with the customer. Super Admins are allowed to upload potential cues regarding the product that would be helpful for the sales reps to keep their prospective buyer interested.Cues are utilised to give the sales representatives a desirable approach so that they can pitch the product in line with what the customer would expect.
Tip: Set of cues/Bulk cues should be uploaded by selecting one product at a time. Super Admins cannot select multiple products and add bulk Cues for all.

A set of Cues are needed for sales reps while they speak with the customer in real time. This comes handy when the sales Reps struggle to build rapport with the customer. Use of cues can help the sales Reps to stick to the topic and understand the customers sentiments and respond accordingly.
Steps to upload bulk cues for a product on Super Admin Salesken Dashboard:
Search For Organisation Name on the Search bar (under the “Create Organisation” button).
Select the product needed to upload Bulk Cues for, (In case of multiple products) using the drop down.
Navigate to “Create Bulk Cues” for the product.

Any supporting documents for the Bulk Cues can be added by clicking on the “Drop files here or click to upload” section of the page. You can also drag and drop a file from your system into this section.
The document should consist of Cue_type, Name, Trigger_words, Cue_content and speaker. File type should be (.xlsx)
The “RESET” button on the template helps to reset the cues that are uploaded for a product.
Now the user has uploaded the bulk cues of a specific product for your organisation.
Uploading of Bulk Cues for a product on Super Admin

Each User has a Unique User ID, Email, and a Number.
User list page provides Super Admin the authority to change various parameters with respect to the users.

Create User: It allows to create a new user into the organisation.

For salesken any activity performed on the dashboard is called as a task. It can vary from making a call, sending an sms, conducting a webinar etc.. Task list is a page that provides super admin the information about the overall task performed by an organisation over a mentioned time period. It showcases the stats on Number of calls made, Call Duration and Average Call Duration of an Organisation.
Super Admin has the authority to recalculate, re-analyze, clear user tasks, and categorise tasks as analysed or unanalysed based on the stats provided.

Let's say the organisation has completed a number of tasks. An individual task Id is assigned to each of the tasks. The users, teams, manager, associate, or an admin carry out tasks. A task list includes a table containing the task's start and end times, duration, status, direction, signals received, and service provider employed for the work may assist an organisation keep track of all tasks carried out inside it.
Today's call: This block gives the total number of calls made by the User / Organization on the current day.
Today's call duration: This block gives the sum of all the call's duration made by the User / Organization on the current day.
Today's average call duration: This block gives the average of all the call's duration made by the User / Organization on the current day.
Yesterday's call: This block gives the total number of calls made by the User / Organization on the previous day.
Yesterday's call duration: This block gives the sum of all the call's duration made by the User / Organization on the previous day.
Yesterday's average call duration: This block gives the sum of all the call's duration made by the User / Organization on the previous day.
Task ID: This is the unique id given to every task performed by the user.
Time: This shows the time when call / task is created.
From User: This shows the name of the User who initiates the task or sends the call.
To User: This shows the name of the User who attended the call from the receiving side.
Call Duration: This gives the time taken by the call when it is in progress from pickup to dropping point of the call.
Status: This gives the status of the task that is under analysis. There are three status of Tasks : Completed, Incompleted, InProgress.
Type Of Call: This shows the type of call / task performed by the User. There are two types of calls : Inbound and Outbound.
Inbound Calls: An inbound call is one that a client / customer initiates to an agent or it is received by the agents.
Outbound Calls: An outbound call is one that is initiated by an agent to the client / customer.
Signals Caught: This gives the signals that are found during the conversation between agent and customer. There are two types of Signals found in a task : Semantic Signals and Emotion Signals.
Provider: This shows the service provider which is used to perform the task.
Call SID: This shows the unique id of the service provider which is used to make a call.
Disposition: This shows the disposition status of the task.
Date and time: The super admin can set the date and time range for the tasks that should be presented on the task table using this tab.
Recover Audio: This helps the super admin to obtain/access the audio file for a single task or a number of tasks using their task Ids.
Clear Task: The organisation's Super Admin can delete tasks that need not be analysed any more.
Re-calculate/Re-Analyse: The Super Admin can use this button to recalculate the tasks in the task table.
CRM: The super admin can use it to filter out the updated and not updated tasks using the drop down.
Task: The super admin can use it to filter out the Analysed and unanalysed tasks using the drop down.
Copy/Excel/CSV button: These buttons are used to copy/download the table content.
Steps to go to task list of the organisation:
Search for the Organisation Name on the Search bar (under the “Create Organisation” button).
On the Report Page Click on the “Task List” from the Top Menu toolbar.
Click on the “Recover Audio” Button on the Task List page.
Enter the Task Ids for the audio files that need to be restored.
Click on “SUBMIT” to recover the audio files.
Click on the “ Re-calculate/Re-analyse” Button on the Task list page
Choose the Analysis Type from the drop down ( Re-Analysis/Re-calculate).
Add products that need to be Analysed or calculated.
Input the Minimum Duration of the task that need to be analysed (in sec) (Optional)
Provide the Analysis URL  if any. (Optional)
Provide information on the task that needs to be fetched from the SQL database under “Task Fetch SQL” (Optional).

How to Update Win/Lost Data on Super Admin

Win/Lost data is the information gathered to optimise the most effective way of sales process for an organisation. This model analyses the data (Win/Loss) and attempts to identify the key factors that contributed to a Win or Loss. It then develops a strategy that must be implemented in the current situation. It is updated with information such as Email, Phone number and status of the leads (Win/Lost).

It is important at all levels of organisation because it helps to explain why a customer chose a specific solution over others. The sales manager would want to check the win/loss ratio of the leads. By analysing the most recent data, it will identify the patterns that are most productive and recommend a suitable structure to adopt in order to achieve positive results.

If the Win/Loss data is not updated then the Sales managers will not be able to analyse the performance accurately. The organisation may follow an outdated approach towards sales that may reduce the efficiency of producing positive results.
Basically, managers will not have the recent data on which he needs to analyse.

How to Initiate/Run SMS (Signal Management Services) on Super Admin

Signal Management Services (SMS) is AI (Artificial Intelligence) based services that provides Suggested Signals to the products derived from the Data Science Model. Once the signals are generated it suggests these signals on the dashboard and gives an option to the Super Admin if he needs to add the signals or not.
The Admins can accept or reject these signals that the AI has suggested.

Signal Management Service (SMS) reduces the task of sales Rep’s on constantly noting down the key performance indicators (KPI)/Signals while pitching the product. It automatically suggests Super Admin with the signals that are most frequently captured from the previous conversations for a particular product.
The AI basically does two tasks for generating signals,
Scrapping:  AI Scrapes the data from the organisation’s website and tries to obtain data relating to vital information of the products.
Clustering: AI also performs clustering of data from the conversations through transcripts and analyses the common type of Statements/terminologies used and groups them.

How to Re – Index Signals in Super Admin Dashboard
The purpose of Re – indexing is to rebuild the existing index created for a signal’s related to the product.
It replaces the old copy of the signals and provides them a new destination in the database.
Re Indexing provides a way to reduce the space consumption of the index by writing a new version of the index without the dead pages.
If Re indexing is not performed then the query efficiency while searching for signals decreases, hence slowing down the performance.
Re – Indexing needs to be done regularly as it gets an unordered table into an order that will maximize the query’s efficiency while searching.
Steps on how to Re – Index products:
Select the product you need to Re – index (In case of multiple products)
Scroll Down and navigate to Re – Index and click on the button “Click to Re - Index”.
Re – Indexing of signals for a product is done.

How to create an org - Super Admin
How to Create an Organisation on Super Admin

The organization serves as a unit of how the client may establish an environment or an interface and input all the information about their business. An organisation consists of Users, Teams, Admin, Sales Managers and Sales Representatives/Agents.

In an organisation the user is someone who utilizes the salesken dashboard for various operations or tasks. Every user in the organisation (excluding the admin) is divided into teams and assigned a particular role. (Sales Manager/Sales Rep)

Each Team needs to have a Sales Manager who is basically the team leader. All the Sales Reps of the team should be subscribed to the Sales manager and all the teams should be subscribed to the Admin of the organisation. This forms a reporting structure for respective regions.
Tip: A particular user can be both Admin and Sales Manager for an organisation but this is not applicable for a Sales Rep role.

All the users within the organisation need to be licensed in order to perform actions on the salesken dashboard. Users who are unlicensed but subscribed in a team are only allowed to view the salesken dashboard.
Within the organisation users who are licensed will have a unique Username and Password that will log in to their respective dashboard based on the user’s role.
For example: Admin will have access to the Salesken Admin Dashboard.
Sales Manager will have access to the Salesken Sales Manager Dashboard.
Sales Rep/Agent will have access to the Salesken Sales Rep Dashboard.

Salesken organisations can be created by the Super Admin in order to alter any configurations or integrate any applications that are aligned with the organisation. Super Admin can also bulk add Signals & Cues, monitor tasks, alter user details & user settings, re-index signals etc.…

Objective :- As we are not getting dual channel audio from phone burner, we are recording the audio stream from web extension. Previously we are getting the call recording and transcript from cueing and call metadata from CDR but in that case we are getting poor Audio quality.
So now we are getting only the transcript from the cueing to have proper snippet tagged with proper speaker and rest of the things like call recording and call details from Phone Burner API
Note :- Task will get created only if user is logged into web extension while making call from phone burner.

URL :- ​https://www.phoneburner.com/ User ID(Admin) : -  saleskendevPass :- 101010User Id (Sales rep) :- shubhamlohra@salesken.aiPass :- 101010
The working org should have Dialer property under Telephony setting should be “Phoneburner”.
LogTaskFromCueing property under Salesken setting should be “true”.
User should be logged in with the same email in both Phone burner and Salesken extension.
Make a call from phone burner by selecting a contact then check the task created in the salesken
Note :- Phoneburner normal user token is getting expired after every 7 days. Email thread is going on for this issue with phoneburner team.

Acceptance Criteria for DIALER - PCA :- (TO GO LIVE)
Pick up 10 Calls having duration > 10 min
Check Task Details (it should be in sync with dialer)

For every snippet calculate # of words which are to be replaced (i.e. wrong/missed/extra)WER = (S + D + I) / (H + S + D)   -> [H += hits (length of human reference string - S - D ),S += substitutions, D += deletions, I += insertions]
if WER > 20 % ----->  Account is NOT ready to go live. (in case of dual channel audio)
If WER > 25 % -----> Account is NOT ready to go live (in case of Mono channel but task is being created through RTC)
Sales Rep snippet must be tagged under Sales Rep
Take 2 dimension groups (example: need discovery from script intelligence, empathy from selling best practices)
Test for false positives - signals present but wrongly detected
Test for false negatives - signals which should have been present but were missed by data science model
Check reports - whether % of calls shown in intelligence reports is correct
If everything is within 85% fidelity, we give a go ahead for go-live
Correct lead company, name, email, address, deal value, pipeline- stage must be synced
On CRM - for the particular task - we should show - (call type, audio url, duration, call summary (if required), task url of SK, call status and date-time)
For Webinars - we should show - Meeting url, participant list, audio/video url, call summary, task url of SK, call status and date-time
Acceptance criteria for CRM integration - (TO GO LIVE) :-
Task should be pushed for all the leads corresponding to users - 100 %
Call to Lead must be in sync - Test for 50 calls
All calls logged - test for 5 users for all calls for 3 days

These details must be in sync (100 %)  b/w SK and CRM (call type, audio url, duration, call summary (if required), task url of SK, call status and date-time)  & Meeting url, participant list, audio/video url, call summary, task url of SK, call status and date-time
Real Time Cues Test flow and Acceptance criteria :-
Cues Pop up time must be in sync like 1 sec
Cues must come as per sales rep’s Product and playbook
Cues must come on web extension - Chrome and Firefox
Create one script which is having all the intended cues and create TTS
Once cues are set up, write 4-5 variations of cue triggers for 2-3 cues.  i.e in total we test for 10-15 ways of cues
Manually, will need to do 1-2 calls where all the cue triggers are tested post integration
If cues occur over 85-90%, we give a go ahead for go live from the QA team.

Manual UAT After Deployment → Login into Super Admin → Create ORG → Log into Manager Portal → Switch to Admin Portal → Add 5 Sales Rep and assign Caller ID → subscribe (add all the sales Rep under Manger) → Add 3 Sales Rep  under default Team and create new team and 2 members in that team → create new product and custom signal and cues → Go to pipeline and add default product and team under default pipeline → create new pipeline and add new product and team under this pipeline → go to admin settings and enable RTC → Login into Sales Rep portal and make 5 calls (meaningful) from default team sales Rep → make 5 calls from new team sales rep → Check Activity log (count, transcription, signal tagging, talk ratio, date-time, caller id, lead number  and duration) → Check Signal analysis → Check Intelligence Report (SBP and SI) → Check Productivity and Conversation metrics report for all the 10 calls (NAVIGATE TO ALL THE REPORTS AND CHECK FILTERS)
If transcription is below 80%, we have to re-do integration for voice quality or lose the account.
If <85%, ask signal writing team in CS to rewrite signals and DS team to rerun SMS
If <100%, raise bug in jira for priduction team
To be calculated as cues appeared/ total cues % . If less than 85%, signal team to write different cue triggers

The analysis report page gives you insight at a component level of information about the tasks being processed for the analysis(Analysis- It will analyze the call and show the transcription and signals).
Note: Signals will only get captured if the required key words have been spoken during the conversation.

Once the CDR for the task has been completed it is sent for Analysis. All the tasks are being processed by the Master step and sent for processing to the next steps and respective steps send the request to the next upon completion of the request.
Calls that are greater than 60 seconds are sent for the next step of the analysis. And the calls with less than 60 seconds are skipped from getting processed.
Goto Analysis Report (There’s a tab named “Analysis Report” on Superadmin)

Select the filters you want to use to filter the data to view the calls/task of the organization, or at a task level. Once the filter has been applied, click on the graph to see the information further.
Completed - The task has been successfully processed for the respective Analysis step.
Scheduled - The task is yet to be processed for the respective Analysis step.
In-Progress - The tasks are getting processed at that instance for the respective Analysis step.
Awaiting -  The task is yet to be processed for the respective Analysis step and it’s waiting for the previous step to complete.
Skipped - The task has been skipped from processing for the respective Analysis step and further details about getting skipped in the message section.
Failed - The task has failed the respective Analysis step.
Organization - Using organization filter, all the tasks of a particular org can be filtered.
Task Id - Using the task id filter you can identify the events that occurred with a particular task
Date - You can select the date based
You can click on any source to see the progress of the requests being processed by them.
Click on the green plus icon to view more information about the request
Req Id: Request id for the particular task
Task Id: Salesken Task id for the particular call/task
Org Id: Unique id assigned to every organization at Salesken
Status: Status of the task in the Analysis queue
Callsid: Unique call id from the telephony partner
CDR - Call Detail Record (CDR) is the detailed record of all the telephonic calls that pass through a telephone exchange or any other telecommunications equipment.

We fetch these records from the respective dialer and bring it to Salesken and add it to the CDR queue and CDR queue process and try to fetch information like call duration, call recording, call status and related information. If there is any information missing CDR attempts to re-fetch the missing information.
Once the CDR has fetched the audio recording it sends the task for the analysis for the calls which are greater than 60 seconds.
Goto CDR Import Report (There’s a tab named “CDR Import Report” on Superadmin)

Select the filters you want to use to filter the data to view the calls/task of the organisation, or at a task level. Once the filter have been applied, click on the graph to see the information further.

Completed - It means the call/task details has been successfully fetched from the Dialer. Or updated post re-tries. If there is an instance when the call details are present on Dialer and not on Salesken, try recovering the task using Recover Audio. If there is any further discrepancy post to Slack channel #production-issues-v2.

Schduled - The task are yet to be processed and CDR details are pending to get processed. Ideally this number should be on a lower side. If the number is high that means that many task are pending to get processed. Kindly post to Slack channel #production-issues-v2, if you see the number very high to get them resolved.
In-Progress - The tasks are getting processed at that instance.

Failed - The current attempt for the task has failed, and next re-try is being attempted. The CDR tries multiple attempt to fetch the data from the dialer. If the data is not available after all re-tries it marks the task as Completed.
Organization - Using orgnization filter, all the task of a particular org can be filtered.
Task Id - Using task id filter you can identify the events occurred with particular task
You can click on any source to see the progress on the requests being processed by them.
Org Id: Unique id assigned to every organisation at Salesken
Status: Status of the task in the CDR queue

CRM is a technology for managing all company relationships and interactions with their customers and their prospects. The CRM has all information on the leads/customer like Name, email, phone number, deal size, etc, and any other relevant information.
Whenever we integrate with any CRM of any customer, we would like to achieve the following:

A sales manager would want to track all the sales calls which have been performed with their leads/customers from one single place and ideally it’s their CRM. Sales managers would also want the calls made via Salesken to be synced/ logged in their CRM. For such customers, Salesken logs & pushes the calls to their respective CRM.

Many times there could be situations where the calls are not in Sync or they’re not yet pushed to the CRM(includes leads present in the CRM or not present in the CRM, this situation varies with the configuration)Solution:The CRM trigger page on SuperAdmin is more of a debug page which helps you track, view, and manually sync tasks/calls with their CRM.
Goto CRM Trigger Page (There’s a tab named “CRM Trigger” on Superadmin)
Select the filters you want to use to filter the data to view the calls/task of the users, organisation, or at a task level.
Completed - It means the call/task has been successfully logged to the CRM. Further details can be found in Failure/Sucess reason column.

Skipped - Call can not be logged to the CRM as the lead was not found in the CRM. Or there is a mismatch of information between leads. For the call to get logged to the CRM for the skipped status the lead(contact details) needs to be present in the CRM.

Failed - The task has failed to get logged into the CRM due to some error. And the error needs to be fixed from either the end (Salesken or from the Customer). Kindly post to Slack channel #production-issues-v2 along with the task id for the failed task so that the error can be resolved.
Organization - Using the organization filter, all the tasks of a particular org can be filtered.
Email - Using an email filter, all the tasks of a particular user can be filtered.
To re-push/ re-sync the call/task again to the CRM. Or If there is any task which not been pushed to the CRM. Click on the trigger button. And the call will be pushed to the CRM for the Sync.

Based on the respective task status you can confirm to the customer whether the calls/task have been logged to the CRM or not. If there is any failure then the same needs to be resolved. If the same has been skipped/completed then you can share the reason accordingly with the customer on the status of the call being logged to the CRM.
Sample scenarios & how to resolve them with the help of ‘CRM trigger’ page
Customer’s Product operations team raises a support ticket mentioning the calls are not getting logged to the CRM.
Apply an organisation filter for the raised org on the CRM trigger page and you will see the respective status for all the calls/tasks.
Apply the filter at task status (Completed, Skipped, Failed) to check if the tasks have been logged or not and confirm the same accordingly.
If you see all the tasks with completed status that means all the calls have logged to the CRM
If you see the majority of the task with completed status and some with Skipped status, Then it is expected as the leads were not present in the CRM.
If you see tasks in failed status, Kindly post to Slack channel #production-issues-v2 along with the task id for the failed task so that the error can be resolved
If there is any particular task which needs to be re-pushed click on trigger button to re-push it
Sales rep or TL raises a support ticket mentioning the all calls are (or a particular call is) not getting logged to the CRM. Solution :-
Apply email or particular task filter for the raised user or call on the CRM trigger page and you will see the respective status for all the calls/tasks.
Apply the filter at task status (Completed, Skipped, Failed) to check if the tasks have been logged or not and confirm the same with the user accordingly.
CRM trigger count is only valid for the customers:
With whom we have agreed to push the tasks/calls from Salesken to their CRM
Primary Key in Foreign CRM: Logged task/activity id at the respective CRM
CRM Name: Name of the CRM to which call/task was logged
Task Created at: Time when the call was started/initiated
Status: Status of the task whether it was logged in the CRM or not
Lead Id as per Foreign CRM: Lead id at the respective CRM
Call Duration: Duration of the call/task in seconds
Failure / Success Reason: Response received while pushing the task
Email: It is the email of the user who has performed the task

To use your own Plivo account with Salesken. We would need to create XML applications on plivo and have them configured with your plivo account and Salesken Organisation. Once the creds have been created share them with the Salesken support team and they will have them attached to your Salesken Organisation.
authId - It is a unique id of the Plivo account
authToken - It is a common auth of the Plivo account
Username - It is endpoints attached to the XML application
Password - It is endpoints attached to the XML application
A. How to get authId & authToken
Log in to your Plivo account with Admin access.
On the overview dashboard, under the Accounts and Payments section, you will be able to locate them
B. How to create XML application and end point for username and password.
Login to your Plivo account with Admin access.
Click on the Voice icon on the overview dashboard page.
Create an XML application for outbound with the following details.
Name - Salesken_Outbound	Primary Answer URL - https://comm-us.salesken.ai/plivo/voice	Hangup URL - https://comm-us.salesken.ai/plivo/voice
Create an XML application for Inbound with the following details.
Name - Salesken_Inbound	Primary Answer URL - https://comm-us.salesken.ai/plivo/inbound	Hangup URL - https://comm-us.salesken.ai/plivo/inbound
Fill in the username(it will be the prefix of the username created by Plivo)  and password. Select the Salesken_outbound application under configuration and click on submit
Once Endpoint has been created. Go back to the endpoint and open the created endpoint. And you will get the correct username
The password is the same as the one which has filled in during step 9.

To use your own Twilio account with Salesken. We would need to create API keys and TwiML Apps on Twilio and have them configured with your Twilio account and Salesken Organisation. Once the Key has been created share it with the Salesken support team and they will have it attached to your Salesken Organisation.
We need the following set of API & TwiML App SID
Api_key - It can be created on Twilio from the API key section
Api_secret - it is the unique pair of the API key created
Auth_token - It is a common auth of the Twilio account
Account_sid - It is a unique id of the Twilio account
Application_sid - It can be created by creating the Twiml app
Conference_application_sid - It can be created by creating a Twiml app
A. How to get Api_key & Api_secret
Login to your Twilio account with Admin access.
Search for the API key in the search section.
Auth tokens & API keys page will open up. Click on Create API Key
Create an API key with key type as standard. Prefer keeping a friendly name as Salesken. It help will help you on identifying the API keys being in use for Salesken.
A page will open up with SID & Secret. Kindly store the details very carefully. SID is your Api_key & Secret is your Api_secret
Once the Api_key & Api_secret have been successfully stored click on done.
B. How to get Account_sid & Auth_token
Login to your Twilio account with Admin access.
Search for Api key in the search section.
Scroll down to Auth token section and Under Live credentials, you will find the Account SID & Auth token
Search for TwiML Apps in the search section.
TwiML Apps page will open up. Click on Create new TwiML App
Create a TwiML App with the following details under voice configuration.
Once the TwiML app has been created. Click on the TwiML App to open and see the TwiML App SID
Your TwiML App SID is the Application_sid
D. How to get Conference_application_sid
Your TwiML App SID is the Conference_application_sid

Salesken's integration framework enables all Zendesk Sell data, such as accounts, contacts, and opportunities, to be integrated with sales conversations and acts as a system of action through analytical insights
By integrating your Zendesk Sell with Salesken, we would achieve the following:
To avoid the friction and pain of changing their workflows, we provide an option to sync data from their Zendesk Sell to Salesken and vice versa.

Data can be configured through an entity mapping interface as data objects/fields are different in Zendesk Sell & Salesken. Depending on the use case, different entities can be mapped, such as leads, opportunities, and contacts
Task mapping interface helps you to push call/meeting details to Zendesk Sell and this interface helps you to configure which fields (timestamp, call duration, etc..) to be pushed in Zendesk Sell
Conversation information like call summary, call duration, and audio URL can also be pushed to Zendesk Sell
This is a one-click integration, the admin has just to authenticate/authorize the Zendesk Sell to complete the integration.
Here you can see a list of tools that you can integrate with Salesken. Now click on the ‘Connect’ button on the “Zendesk Sell” card
You’ll be redirected to the Zendesk Sell sign-in page to authenticate

Since, this is one click integration, we’ve integrated successfully with Zendesk Sell. Now to customize and leverage the integration as mentioned above, we’ll have to do certain configurations as mentioned below.

The user/ admin has the option to map the different entities in the integrated platform with the entities in Salesken. For example, the user wants to map the lead entity from Zendesk Sell to salesken. In the lead entity the field name in Salesken is ‘Lead Name’, and in Zendesk Sell the corresponding field is ‘Name’.

Salesken's integration framework enables all CRM data, such as accounts, contacts, and opportunities, to be integrated with sales conversations and acts as a system of action through analytical insights
By integrating your CRM with Salesken, we would achieve the following:
To avoid the friction and pain of changing their workflows, we provide an option to sync data from their existing CRM to Salesken and vice versa.

Data can be configured through an entity mapping interface as data objects/fields are different in the CRM & Salesken. Depending on the use case, different entities can be mapped, such as leads, opportunities, and contacts
Revenue & leads stage mapping to give you insights to forecast actually closing deals.
Task mapping interface helps you to push call/meeting details to CRM and this interface helps you to configure which fields (timestamp, call duration, etc..) to be pushed in CRM
Conversation information like call summary, call duration and audio URL can also be pushed to CRM
This is a one-click integration, the admin has just to authenticate/authorize the CRM to complete the integration.
Here you can see a list of tools which you can integrate with Salesken. Now click on the ‘Connect’ button on “CRM” card
You’ll be redirected to the CRM sign-in page to authenticate

Since, this is one click integration, we’ve integrated successfully with the CRM. Now to customize and leverage the integration as mentioned above, we’ll have to do certain configurations as mentioned below.
The user/ admin can import users(sales reps). The admin can create new users, customize user permissions and also remove specific users from the account according to their needs.

The user has the option to select all the win stages in the pipeline. This information will help in discovering patterns in the win conversations as well as help in understanding what a sales associate should do in order to win a conversation.
CRM documents to be created to help users understand the CRM:
Here you can see a list of tools which you can integrate with Salesken. Now click on the ‘Connect’ button on “Dialer” card
You’ll be redirected to the Dialer sign-in page to authenticate
Now to customize and leverage the integration as mentioned above, we’ll have to do certain configurations as mentioned below.

The user/ admin can import users (sales reps) from the integrated platform. The admin can also create new users, edit user permissions and also remove specific users from the account according to their needs.

Their is an API we were hitting at call end (/mergedualaudio). so this api is basically creating the task by calling connector project which creates the task and returns the taskId so on getting the task Id at cueing side we basically merge the agent and customer audio as dual wav and update the audio url in task table for that taskId.	Extension was hitting this API 2 times one on call start and one on call end .so the call  end was working fine and dual task was getting created because of hitting the API on call start.			PhoneBurer has a dialsessionId which can have multiple calls.		when one call ends suppose its dialsessionId = 123 and callid= 456, then task is created for the callsid and audio url updated as dual wav.		after that suppose one more call started for the same dialsessionId so on start we usually hit the phoneburner api to get the toNumber and callid fo the dial session id and here the dial session id is same as the last call so phoneBurner dont have any records at the starting of the call and they give us the last call in response and their were no check on task creation … hence creating dual task for the last call. when their is same dial session id. ​​​Tagged user @Vaibhav Verma@Vaibhav Verma ​Tagged user @Vikas Tiwari@Vikas Tiwari ​Tagged user @Prakash Tiwary@Prakash Tiwary ​Tagged user @Ashish Kumar@Ashish Kumar ​Tagged user @Sumeet Pathak@Sumeet Pathak ​Tagged user @Ravindra@Ravindra ​Tagged user @Allen Richard Kerketta@Allen Richard Kerketta : please add to the document as you think necessary., especially pls comment on the table below.

Although QA is done at a product level, given that a lot of accounts are enterprise accounts for Salesken and involve many new integrations, signals and cue set ups, this document is designed to think through how to improve our product experience by thoroughly testing various integrations before go-live.

Salesken is a complex product, sitting in between telephony, VoiP, Video, emails and chats and data heavy involving several configurations.  We are a work-in-progress. Until we have everything fine-tuned fully on the product, I suggest we do a customer wise QA before Go-Live, particulalry as we are building new integrations for several of them.  Our on-boarding experience is being evolved to improve the customer experience, however until all the creases are ironed, we can start with implementing the following QA for enterprise accounts (over $100k):
For call logging on CRM: Test parameters :
Right call logged on right lead - Test for 50 calls
All calls logged - test for 2-3 users for all calls for 2-3 days
Call duration - test the call duration reported on salesken/ other dialer for what is on the CRM
a) Words missed. For example, if 10 words were missed in 100, false negative rate is 10%
b) words wrongly transcribed : For example if 3 words were wrongly transcribed out of 100, Word error rate is 3%
If transcription is below 80%, we need to test the integration quality and get dual channel recording/ b
etter quality - account is NOT ready to go live.
Take 5 calls with duration over 10 mins
Take 2 dimension groups (example: need discovery from script intelligence, empathy from selling best practises)
Once cues are set up, write 4-5 variations of cue triggers for 2-3 cues.  ie in total we test for 10-15 ways of cues
2, Manually test call summary on Salesken with call summary logged
Here is an excel doc on what we can test
Check if right language has been input for ASR (ENUS, ENIN etc)
Connected conversationsConversations answered by lead and the duration of the call is greater than 1 second
Meaningful conversationsConversations with total duration greater than 60 seconds
Quality conversationsConversations which are meaningful and have at least one signal present in the conversation
Not answered The call went through but no one answered
Busy The call went through but received a busy response
FailedThe call didn’t go through because it was failed/not connectedPossible reasons could be: destination is unreachable or incorrect number or system has failed
Connect ratio:( Total # of connected calls)/(Total # of calls)
Good length ratio(The number of conversations with duration between 3 to 6 minutes) / (Total conversations)
Talk time ratio% of the time, the rep spoke on the conversations
Total # of cues detected in the conversations
Cue adherence% of cues the rep has adhered to the cues shown
Total Active users# of users who have made calls in last 7 days
Sales cycleTime taken to close the deal
Follow-up reportDistribution of “Average # of follow-ups per lead” vs “all sales reps”
Superimposition of (“Conversation counts” + “Conversation duration”) vs “all users”/“all teams”
→ Response it will give Code to be used to access token
2.  POST request to get access token and Refresh token
Once access token expires we need to fetch new access token using the refresh_token obtained above.
Upon receipt of a refresh token, all old refresh tokens are revoked. So we need to store refresh token every time an access token is generated.

Objective :  The purpose of this document is to define the process of adding new CRM/Telephony systems  and time required to build the connector.
Integration Use case  :  We build connector to support following standard integration use cases
Integrate sales call with CRM to  get more insights  (Telephony +CRM)
Integrate CRM  for lead and revenue intelligence ( CRM)
Integrate Telephony system  to get conversation analytics (Telephony : PCA)

Prioritisation  : Each system is evaluated for its business value and prioritised for building the connector.  A weekly review meeting is held to set priorities with different stakeholders.                              Stakeholders :  Engineering , Sales, Partner & Product.

System Availability (License) : If system comes with trail license , then we create trial account and proceed. If system doesn't come with trial license , then license procurement  is needed. We acquire license either by partnership or direct purchase.  Stakeholders :  Engineering , Partner and Finance
Understanding of System : We understand basic functionality of systems and integration use cases. CRM system
Here is a basic list of tasks that must be completed for a CRM system.
a. Configuration : Configure User and Customer fields. Understand the  API enablement .

b. CRM Entity understanding :  Create & update lead , contact , opportunity, Task/Activity and custom entity .  Check the relation between these associations (Lead-->Opportunity etc) and how to build these relationship.
c. Understand the field  and usages.      Some important information like deal/revenue storage needs to be found . Other storage we look for states and win loss information.
d. Sales process flow : Configure pipeline and stages. Update the lead with pipeline data and different      stages field and update .
e. Create and update users . Add and update user details.
f.  Integration flow : Conclude how to map call details with Lead and where to keep call information.
g. Click to call functionality  : How to enable click to call functionality in system.
Telephony System
Here is a basic list of tasks that must be completed for a Telephony system.
a.  Configuration :  Configuration of Users , Call enablement , Channel , Timezone and enablement of     real time streams.
b.  Making Call:   Make a call and end a call from the system.
c. Understand the mode of calls available with the system. (Inbound/Outbound/Conference)
d.  Understand the timezone in which call data is getting published
e. Understand the call lifecycle and its  status along with call party status.
f. Availability of audio recording and their format. (Audio extension, sampling rate and their channel : mono aur dual)
4. API evaluation  : Once we have basic understanding of system , we evaluate the APIs to integrate with Salesken. Here is how we evaluate API :
5. Development :      Once concluded with feasibility, development starts under a process. (refer dev process section for details)
Here is high level task for CRM & Telephony system
CRM                                                                                                                                                                                  a. Authorization
h. Dev integrated testing and big fixing
c. CDR Import : Fetch call metadata along with audio recording
d. Data storage : Audio recording manipulation if needed, Handling inbound/outbound call, stages computation, connection
e.  Dev integrated testing and big fixing
f.    Documentation
Below is the details around Test process for new Integration request of CRM/CDR -
7. Documentation :   Here we build a non technical document which can be sharable to all.  This document contains following information  :
a. Summary about system and web link.
b. Integration use cases
c. How to configure in salesken .
For CDR :  It takes 7-8 days of time with 1 person of effort
For CRM : It takes 10 days of time with 1 person of effort
Acquisition of commercial license takes around 2 to 3 weeks of times.
1.5 person per day  ( UI , Backend and Testing)
This is integrated testing and bug fixing.
This is done during testing time. Effort of 2hr is needed
1.  Sprint Allocation:  A sprint is assigned to connector. There are two sprints in a months of 10 days.
2.   Story Planing :      Developer understand , plan and estimate the Task.
3.    Daily scrum :   All the development  tracking is happening in daily team scrum.
4.    Iterative development:   Development is happening in chunk and frequent commit are happening.
5.     Code review :   All code are getting reviewed and getting scanned with static code analyzer namely Sonarlit.
6.    Code is getting committed against story.
7.     Iterative testing :  Dev is planned in a way so that  testing can happen in parallel .
Testing Process - Below is the details around QA PROCESSES -
Sprint Planning - QA sprint align with Dev Sprint.
Story Grooming - we provide all details, dependencies, entry and exit criteria for deliverable.
Task Allocation and Estimation - Task creation for each story with resource allocation and estimation.
Test Planning - this activity is combine of Test case writing and review. we also plan test according to req and use case.
Test Execution - Execution of the planned test as per define test methodologies and cases around.
Bug Validation - After planned execution we plan bug validation after issue fixes.

Phoneburner is a power dialler which captures every calls made by an agent, understand what's being said and gain critical information. it helps sales teams get through the calls faster and have up to 4x more live conversations.

SALESKEN gives you incredible insights into the last mile of customer-salesperson interactions. See how your sales team communicates with customers on calls, presentations, and webinars and get insights into what they are doing right, and where they need help. Salesken also lets you help your sales team improve with customised learning content to help them up their game and win!

By integrating PhoneBurner with SALESKEN , it is very elite and easy process to pull all the important call data, and also sync the users using any dial er (in this case PhoneBurner), the same is presented in a very informative way in SALESKEN user interface page. Once the important data is pulled, SALESKEN does all the call analytics on the basis of requirements for you. With our product end user can directly login (via admin credentials) and integrate their PhoneBurner account in a negligible amount of time.
Create an OrgId and make sure that the Created OrgId points to admin.
LogIn to Salesken by using the Url - https://web-us.salesken.ai/login using the created Credentials i.e, username and password which was created while creating an OrgId.

In Phone Burner site You need to provide Redirect URL this can be done by following the below steps* https://www.phoneburner.com/ and click on login* Utilize the provided username and password.* Click on the account logo place on top right corner, select Integration Settings → Custom Applications → click on view → Then provide Authorization callback URL:

Once logged in using URL https://web-us.salesken.ai/ click on Account logo present on top right corner, select “Switch to Admin” → Click on hamburger sign present on top left corner → integrations → In an integration Page Kindly click connect (this option will be present if a user isn’t integrated already) → Phone burner page opens up, two options will be displayed.
If the user is Already integrated the user get’s to see the option as Details rather Connect.

If the user isn’t integrated , once Clicked on Approve Button, A phone burner page opens asking Username and password to authenticate, you need to login using Phone Burner credentials, once that's done the authorisation will be successful and the redirection of page will be to the provided url specified in the field of Authorization callback URL: of phone burner Integration page settings.
if Clicked on Deny button, the agent will be logged out from the Salesken Account, he or she needs to re-login the same account.
Ellipsis (Quick actions) : Present in Salesken Integration Page with in PhoneBurner Module → Click on it
The Reset Option is used to remove the integration of the agent.
The agent can be Re integrate by clicking on Connect option available and follow the further stated steps

This option once clicked will display the number of Agents using Phone Burner through Salesken , the ones which are not yet Synced can be Synced by checking mark the CheckBox which will be prefixed to them and then click on Sync.
If there isn’t any CheckBox present, then those agents are already Synced.

This document will provide all the information necessary for the execution phase such as the project's goals, objectives, the scope of work, limitations, and resources of Salesken’s integration with Google Calendar along with Webinar Integrations like Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams. In this doc, the positive flow of integration is discussed along with known issues and the issue which are to be targeted in the next release.
Salesken’s user has the same email id as the google email he is using. i.e. while integrating calendar user’s email in salesken must be the same email that he/she authorizes.
Users with the same domain (i.e. all users having email ending with “@salesken.ai" ) must be in one organization.
We only create tasks only when the activity/meeting is scheduled with at least one person/email outside the organizer’s domain.
Calendar fetch is a scheduled cron job that runs every 5 min.  As a result, the creation/updation of any event will take a max of 5 min to reflect.

Meet/Zoom bot joining process is initiated 2 minutes early. So, if the event is changed just before 2 min will not impact stop the bot to try joining the meet, and failing to join will result in blank task creation(in case of meet only but in case of zoom PCA will work but real time cueing will not work).

The bot runs on the pre-scheduled google calendar events. The lead and SCP creation will be done on the calendar level. If any new participant joins the meeting without a calendar invitation. The bot will treat it as a Lead but will not be able to create a Lead/SCP.
What if User is invited from external buyer party for a google meet/Zoom meeting? And what if there are two user of same organization in that invitation?
The exact information of Agent or Customer Snippet as Calendar name and google meet/Zoom meet name might vary.
Support for multiparty for all actors/participants of the Meeting/Webinar.

Playbook cues are cues that are related to the on-going conversation.  They are of different types:
These cues are around the 7 script intelligence dimensions:
These cues should be based off some threshold values through the call
Ideally the markers on these should be on the cue box, so the agent can understand the temperature of the call and what gaps exist
Read ​https://salesken.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MA/pages/2098987009 ​Tagged user @Ashish Kumar@Ashish Kumar pls have a new document to link up to the latest thinking on this

Sequencing: Sequencing of these dimensions is based off a) an ideal sequence  at signal level created in the onboarding wizard b) 1-n sequences at signal level that can be discovered in the win calls.  The assumption is that sequencing is relevant in winning playbooks and data will find the sequences in winning calls.

Feedback loops : If a dimension has incomplete coverage, a feedback loop can discover the gaps and cue on the missing dimensions. This is particularly helpful when mandatory signals are present in the onboarding data.  ​Tagged user @Vaibhav Verma@Vaibhav Verma ​Tagged user @Sahul Darla@Sahul Darla ​Tagged user @Sandeep Sahu@Sandeep Sahu In onboarding wizard we need to have option to select mandatory signals
Conversation state: These cues are also triggered on the basis of turn based win/loss model which will predict the next best action on the basis of highest win probability at any given turn

Unlike the playbook dimension cues, these cues have to be triggered through out the call.

Empathy: Demonstrate empathy for your customer's situations.  Examples of empathy sentences:
I am sorry you are going through this
Rapport building: Build a strong rapport with your customer by enquiring about his/ her job, family, sport, passion, interests etc
Positive energy: Sound more positive on the call. Smile, use words that convey good energy, speak in a louder volume.
Urgency: Create urgency for next steps through offers that may expire, discounts or limited availability
Consultative: Ask more questions and understand the customer’s needs better.  Why have you enquired? What problems are you facing? What are your goals?
Listening:  You are talking too much.  Ask the customer questions and listen more.
