Approach : The idea is to establish a conference call between multiple legs, using Asterisk. To start with, we establish a call between an agent and a customer using ARI(s). There’s a unique callSid saved for this call on Elastic search. Once this is achieved, we enable barging in of another leg(say, a Manager wants to jump in on to the call), fetching the same callSid from Elastic Search, and generating further new call legs. The Conference(barge) call request is intercepted by the API exposed on CPAAS, the corresponding logic is written in AsterCallControl to create a new channel for conference and add it on the same bridge as that of agent and customer.

Below are the curls:To establish a call between an Agent and a Customer:curl --location --request POST 'http://localhost:8084/call/proxy' \--header 'AUTH_API_KEY: S@al34swfrWEasd' \--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \--data-raw '{"toNumber": "09534563317","fromNumber": "09748837736","callerId": "08068840026","providerId" : 3}'

To barge some other leg on that same conference call : curl --location --request POST 'http://localhost:8084/barge' \--header 'AUTH_API_KEY: abcd123456' \--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \--data-raw '{"callSid": "8adc7d00-7774-4dbb-ba24-15f7c3254193","callerId": "08068840026","number":"09845287363"}'

To use the Microsoft identity platform endpoint, you must register your app using the Azure app registration portal. You can use either a Microsoft account or a work or school account to register an app.
Sign in to the Azure Portal using either work or school account or a personal Microsoft account.
In the left-hand navigation pane, select the Azure Active Directory service, and then select App registrations > New registration
When the Register an application page appears, enter your application's registration information like name, supported account type and redirect uri.

Credentials are used by confidential client applications that access a web API. Examples of confidential clients are web apps, other web APIs, or service-type and daemon-type applications. Credentials allow your application to authenticate as itself, requiring no interaction from a user at runtime. You can add both certificates and client secrets (a string) as credentials to your confidential client app registration.
In the Azure portal, in App registrations, select your application.
Select Certificates & secrets > Client secrets > New client secret.
Select an expiration for the secret or specify a custom lifetime.
Once you've registered both your client app and web API and you've exposed the API by creating scopes, you can configure the client's permissions to the API by following these steps:
If you have access to multiple tenants, use the Directory + subscription filter in the top menu to select the tenant containing your client app's registration.
Select Azure Active Directory > App registrations, and then select your client application
Select API permissions > Add a permission > My APIs.
Select the web API you registered as part of the prerequisites : Delegated permissions
Under Select permissions, expand the resource whose scopes you defined for your web API, and select the permissions the client app should have on behalf of the signed-in user.
Permissions Required for Email Integration : User.Read, Mail.ReadBasic.All, Mail.Read, Mail.ReadWrite, offline_access.
2. GETTING ACCESS TOKEN FOR THE USER WITH PERMISSIONS

To use Microsoft Graph to read and write resources on behalf of a user, your app must get an access token from the Microsoft identity platform and attach the token to requests it sends to Microsoft Graph. One common flow used by native and mobile apps and also by some Web apps is the OAuth 2.0 authorization code grant flow.

The first step to getting an access token for many OpenID Connect (OIDC) and OAuth 2.0 flows is to redirect the user to the Microsoft identity platform /authorize endpoint.With the Microsoft identity platform endpoint, permissions are requested using the scope parameter. In this example, the Microsoft Graph permissions requested are User.Read and Mail.Read, which will allow the app to read the profile and mail of the signed-in user. The offline_access permission is a standard OIDC scope that is requested so that the app can get a refresh token. The app can use the refresh token to get a new access token when the current one expires.

2.2 Consent ExperienceAfter sending an authorization request, the user will be asked to enter their credentials to authenticate with Microsoft. The Microsoft identity platform v2.0 endpoint will also ensure that the user has consented to the permissions indicated in the scope query parameter. If the user hasn't consented to any of those permissions and if an administrator hasn't previously consented on behalf of all users in the organization, they'll be asked to consent to the required permissions.

2.3 Authorization ResponseIf the user consents to the permissions your app requested, the response will contain the authorization code in the code parameter. Here's an example of a successful response to the previous request. Because the response_mode parameter in the request was set to query, the response is returned in the query string of the redirect URL.
2.4 Get a TokenYour app uses the authorization code received in the previous step to request an access token by sending a POST request to the /token endpoint.
Although the access token is opaque to your app, the response contains a list of the permissions that the access token is good for in the scope parameter.
2.6 Use the access token to call Microsoft
After you have an access token, you can use it to call Microsoft Graph by including it in the Authorization header of a request. The following request gets the profile of the signed-in user.
A successful response will look similar to the following (some response headers have been removed)
2.7 Use the refresh token to get a new access token

Access tokens are short lived, and you must refresh them after they expire to continue accessing resources. You can do so by submitting another POST request to the /token endpoint, this time providing the refresh_token instead of the code.
2.8 Saving access credentials of the user in the backend
Once we get the access_token of the user from /token endpoint , we save his/her credentials in user_setting table for future use.

The body of the message. It can be in HTML or text format. Find out about safe HTML in a message body.
The first 255 characters of the message body. It is in text format.
The ID of the conversation the email belongs to.
Indicates the position of the message within the conversation.
The date and time the message was created.
The date and time information uses ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.
The flag value that indicates the status, start date, due date, or completion date for the message.

The owner of the mailbox from which the message is sent. In most cases, this value is the same as the sender property, except for sharing or delegation scenarios. The value must correspond to the actual mailbox used. Find out more about setting the from and sender properties of a message.

Indicates whether the message has attachments. This property doesn't include inline attachments, so if a message contains only inline attachments, this property is false. To verify the existence of inline attachments, parse the body property to look for a src attribute, such as .

Unique identifier for the message. By default, this value changes when the item is moved from one container (such as a folder or calendar) to another. To change this behavior, use the Prefer: IdType="ImmutableId" header. See Get immutable identifiers for Outlook resources for more information. Read-only.
The importance of the message. The possible values are: low, normal, and high.
The classification of the message for the user, based on inferred relevance or importance, or on an explicit override. The possible values are: focused or other.

A collection of message headers defined by RFC5322. The set includes message headers indicating the network path taken by a message from the sender to the recipient. It can also contain custom message headers that hold app data for the message.
Returned only on applying a $select query option. Read-only.
The message ID in the format specified by RFC2822.
Indicates whether a read receipt is requested for the message.
Indicates whether the message is a draft. A message is a draft if it hasn't been sent yet.
The date and time the message was last changed.
The unique identifier for the message's parent mailFolder.
The date and time the message was received.

The account that is actually used to generate the message. In most cases, this value is the same as the from property. You can set this property to a different value when sending a message from a shared mailbox, for a shared calendar, or as a delegate. In any case, the value must correspond to the actual mailbox used. Find out more about setting the from and sender properties of a message.
The date and time the message was sent.

The part of the body of the message that is unique to the current message. uniqueBody is not returned by default but can be retrieved for a given message by use of the ?$select=uniqueBody query. It can be in HTML or text format.
The URL to open the message in Outlook on the web.

You can append an ispopout argument to the end of the URL to change how the message is displayed. If ispopout is not present or if it is set to 1, then the message is shown in a popout window. If ispopout is set to 0, then the browser will show the message in the Outlook on the web review pane.
The message will open in the browser if you are logged in to your mailbox via Outlook on the web. You will be prompted to login if you are not already logged in with the browser.

The ADMIN can control the setting in admin settings for Primary Calling Method to be Conference.If the Conference is selected as a Calling method, This enables associate to make an outbound call as a conference call.Additional features have now been introduced in Conference calling called Call Controls for a Manager. This allows Manager to do multiple functions over ongoing calls. They see all the ongoing calls in the Call Controls page and can choose to:1. Barge:Call Barging is a feature that allows Manager to drop in on live calls between the Customer and the Associate. Once the Manager joins the call, an announcement happens in the call which is heard only by Associate, that only lets the Associate know that Manager has joined the call.This feature gives the advantage to the manager/supervisor to ensure the call quality and also coach the agents.2. Listen:Call Listen allows a Manager to listen into live calls between the Customer and the Associate.  Once the Manager joins the call, an announcement happens in the call which is heard only by Associate, that only lets the Associate know that Manager has joined the call.This feature gives the advantage to the manager/supervisor to observe and ongoing call and gather feedback points to improve quality of the calls.3. Whisper:Call Whisper is a feature that allows Manager to join in on live calls between the Customer and the Associate, but only the Associate can listen Manager’s voice. Once the Manager joins the call, an announcement happens in the call which is heard only by Associate, that only lets the Associate know that Manager has joined the call.This feature gives the advantage to the manager/supervisor to give live instructions to the agents.Developers: Yash

Manual Tasks we do while creating a new infra and How can we automate it
Here is a list of some Manual Tasks which are overwhelming and Time-consuming as well during a new setup:
Every time we need to create some Instances / VM to host our services.
We need to do manual configurations related to tomcat and Java in instances.
We need to change db.properties in services ( Changing this in one service is fine but doing the same thing in 10 services is a big hack)
Creation of Instances can be automated using Terraform scripts (No Manual Efforts)
We can utilize Ansible or shell scripts to make required configurations in instances.
Ansible or shell scripts to make required configurations in instances
We need to utilize either environmental variables or some managed services from the cloud for secrets management.
managed services from the cloud for secrets management
Why are Environmental variables not managed services?
As Environmental variables are easy to configure and fewer code changes are required.

As we are providing on-premise deployments to some big giants (ICICI) which may not allow us to use anything coming from a public domain, It will not feasible for us to use a cloud-native solution for this.
not allow us to use anything coming from a public domain
We are frequently migrating to different cloud services so, It will be difficult to manage secrets in each cloud offering.

Alignment: Verify that dynamic elements align and space correctly.
Width: Check whether each element's width adapts to the viewport.

Height: This is usually unchanged in responsive design, but for some cases, you might specify element height relative to the viewport (like Menu or Edit buttons) on mobile devices. Test this on different mobile browsers and orientations.
Spacing and padding: Verify that elements don't overlap.
Conditional rendering: Test that elements can appear, hide, and resize based on viewport size, dynamically.

We currently have two major problem sets:1. If customer wants to analyse a call recording by himself, there is no way on our platform to do this.2. During onboarding a new client or during Customer trials, there is a huge pain which our business/operations team has to undergo in getting customer call recordings uploaded and analysed.This has a huge dependency on technology team and thereby impacts timelines.This feature provides a self-serve way through the Manager’s account to upload a call recording by themselves for an associate, which will then be submitted for analysis automatically.Once analysed, these recordings will be visible in the Activity log, as Call Type: FILE UPLOADEDThis recording will be analysed like any other call, and hence will have necessary signals, and all the meta data associated with the call.

Activity Log (Field Addition)As part of the Activity log download, there is a new field that has been added called “end Time”.Previously, if our customers wanted to query on the actual end Time of the call, they had to add up manually the start Time and the handling time.This was a cumbersome process. With the addition of this new field, customers have direct access to the end Time value in the downloaded version of Activity log.Developers: Vishaldeep

1.toNumber:  The Destination number to which the call will arrives to the End User. Append 0 before an indian number when hitting an endpoint
2.fromNumber: The Source number from which you can make a call .make sure to append 0 before hitting an Endpoint.
3.Callerid: Allows you to see an incoming caller’s name and number before you answer.
4.Providerid: An unique identification number which is set as 3 by default
5.AUTH_API_KEY: An Auth Api key to be added in header section for Authentication purpose before making an authenticated Api Call request .

Vicidial is a telephony solution designed to interact with Asterisk to implement outbound calls.The setup involves three major components: 1) Setting up a Http server - to host vicidial on localhost2)Setting up and configuring Asterisk - to enable outbound calls 3)Setting up a  MySQL server - to store call logs

To make an outbound call using ViciDial, we need to configure all three above components on Linux platform. We need to write in multiple Dialplans in Asterisk to make sure it understands and configures the calling facility. [Dialplan is a scripting language meant for Asterisk to enable voice calling using it. It enables the developers to control the call flow and route the calls between different users based on the script and configuration]

VICIDIAL is an Open Source Under AGPL V2.0 Licence  Software Suite that is designed to interact with Asterisk Open source PBX Phone System to act as a Complete inbound/outbound Contact centre suite with inbound email support as well to Extend the functionality of phone and System.
The Asterisk System that has a Zap/DAHDI(T1/E1/PSTN) teleco lines or VOIP (IAX /SIP )trunks and many different kinds of Softphones and hard phones as well

VIC DIAL can dial predictively at a ratio one call at a time .ASTGUI client a GUI Client Application was created for more advanced features of Asterisk to be used by anyone using even a single line phone.
Vicidial has an Agent API and Non-Agent Api this classes are intended to use in PHP
Scripts are made up of PERL and PHP. It uses MYSQL as it’s Database Server Apache/Httpd for its Front End web interface and Linux as its operating System.
The Latest version of VICIDial uptodate is  2.2 release candidate 7.
●      Inbound, Outbound Blended Call, Email & Chat Handling
Asterisk Server (version - 1.2,1.4, 11 and 13) with proper S/w installed
4.MYSQL 5.0 Server  or Greater Database Server (local/Remote)
Process flow of One call at a time call

GUI assigns a Open Meetme extension to the user called Session-id

This system is dependant on a MySQL server(version 4.0.XX or higher) acting as the storage place of all data

and settings for the system. This was done so that it would be very scalable and flexible. This application draws  on a lot of the core scripting inside of the astGUIclient suite of applications and was built with flexibility in mind.
We have used VICIDIAL for over 3 years now on up to 160 seats at once across 7 separate Asterisk servers
all using the same MySQL server and dialling on the same campaign. It is important to keep in mind that
because VICIDIAL uses Asterisk meetme rooms for it’s dialling that the Asterisk server will see an increased
load as compared to a simple Zap/SIP-only calls.

Linux Operating System as its platform, without an operating system its nothing. You can choose from several distributions like Slackware Linux, Gentoo Linux, Ubuntu Server, CentOS, and OpenSuSe. For this document we will be using Ubuntu Server 8.0.4 LTS.
MySQL 5.0+, this is the “brain” of the entire system, this is where call logs are stored, agent login sessions, leads and other data, the later version comprises 106  tables.
Apache or Httpd web server, this is used mainly to provide access for the administration interface and for the agent interface, think of this as the window or a door or basically a front end
. 4. An IP PBX, VICIdial uses Asterisk Open-Source IPPBX as its means to dial and receive incoming calls.

Meetme Conference bridge module of asterisk as its way of bridging a call to an agent which I will explain more later. Meetme uses a timing device, can be a digium or sangoma hardware or basically ztdummy which comes with Zaptel or Dahdi tools.
Perl CPAN modules as its backend to communicate with the Asterisk Server, they tell asterisk to process calls, recordings, and send the data to the MYSQL Database.
The agent logs in through a web interface provided by the web server which is provided namely vicidial.php its usually default at this address: http://yourlocalipaddress/agc/vicidial.php

Then agent inputs phone login, password, agent username and password, credentials are being checked against the MySQL database to see if the agent and phone exists or not. If not an error is returned telling you that you have the wrong password or simply not displaying the list of campaigns you are allowed to login to.

If those credentials are correct, MySQL server then allocates a conference number from vicidial_conferences table to the agent, the asterisk server will then call the extension where the agent is connected, for example an agent uses cc100 to connect its softphone then the asterisk server will then calls cc100, the softphone receives the call, the agent answers it and automatically the agent is put into a MeetMe conference bridge. You will hear a voice telling you “You are the only person in this conference”.

Granting that leads are loaded for the campaign, the perl scripts are in charge of putting those leads into a hopper, a hopper acts like a buffer wherein the contents of the hopper are information, contents of the hopper are then sent to the Asterisk Server telling it to call those numbers that are in the hopper depending on the DIAL mode that is set in the campaign.

Once the agent is put into that campaign, the Asterisk Server then dials those numbers in the hopper, once a call is connected or is answered, automatically the Asterisk Server will bridge that call to a meetme conference where an agent is waiting.

Agent and called party now converses, once a call is hung up, its then written to the call logs and then the web interface popups a disposition interface for the agent to dispose of the call. If call recording is enabled, the recording scripts in the cron job will be processing it and it will be put default under /var/spool/asterisk/monitorDONE respectively.
At the end of the shift agent logs out, the MeetMe Conference bridge is destroyed and the conference table in the database is updated and the agent has logged out.

Server Hardware – Intel Core 2 Quad 3.0 ghz Processor, Intel Motherboard, 4 GB DDR2 800 Mhz RAM, Western Digital Raptor 320 GB 10,000 RPM SATA hard drive, 550 watts branded power supply (HEC, Gigabyte, Thermaltake, you choose), A full tower casing (Li-anLi, Gigabyte Poseidon). This build can cost around 30,000 – 40,000 pesos or around 600 or 800USD the last time I set up one of this kind.

Ubuntu Server 8.0.4 LTS 64 bit Linux Operating System – Since this is a stand alone server, a 64-bit version would be really nice, in my deployments using a 64 bit operating system I see a performance increase in MySQL and Apache web servers, asterisk performance hardly had an increase, also on the other hand 64 bit has good memory management, it can detect RAM which is higher than 3 GB flawlessly, for its other advantages you can look it up at google.

Asterisk 1.4.21.2 Version – VICIdial has also their own pre patched version of this asterisk release which I've been using recently, in my observation asterisk 1.4.21.2 version is much better in handling SIP carriers compared to asterisk 1.2.30.4 which is also another good version to use for VICIdial. For reliability and stability both are at par. My observations may differ from others though. But so far I have upgraded 87 servers to Asterisk 1.4.21.2 and they seem to be running fine without an issue till now.

Google.com – If ever you stumble upon issues during your installation there's always google for you to copy and paste the error, who knows there could be lots of you who are experiencing it too. ​http://www.vicidial.org/VICIDIALforum/

VERIFY THAT THE CORRECT DRIVE IS SHOWN FOR INSTALLATION; Everything after this step results in any data that previously exists on the target drive being lost

After verifying that the correct OS drive is shown, use the left or right arrow keys to highlight ‘Yes’ and press ENTER to start the installation; After a few minutes the server will reboot and bring you to a ‘vicibox9 login: ‘ prompt
Type ‘root’ at the login prompt and press the ENTER key.

At the ‘Password:’ prompt type in ‘vicidial’ and press the ENTER key The very first time you log into the system after installing it a OS setup wizard will run. This will give you the option to change the language, keyboard layout, and local time zone. Afterwards you should end up at a red prompt that says vicibox9:~ #
If not already, please login as the ‘root’ user to get to the root prompt. The default root password is ‘vicidial’ unless changed previously

When prompted, type in the new root password you want to use keeping in mind that it is case sensitive; The password is not shown on the screen for security reasons 4. When prompted, type in the new root password a second time to verify it; If the password chosen is considered weak the system might complain that it is a ‘BAD PASSWORD’ but will still allow you to use it Please use secure passwords where possible. A strong password is at least 12 characters long and a mix of upper case, lower case, numbers, and special characters like ! % @ _ - ( ) etc. A randomly generated password string is the most secure but usually the most difficult to remember. Regardless of the password you choose please make sure you can remember the password. If the root password is lost then nothing can be done on the local system. It is not trivial to recover a lost root password and requires someone to physically be at the server during the recovery.

For example, if the IP address for this server is an RFC1918 private IP like 192.168.X.Y or 10.X.Y.Z then this should be considered an Internal Zone connection.

13. Press ALT-N to accept the configuration changes and return to the Network Settings screen. 14. Press ALT-S to configure the Hostname and DNS settings.
15. Press ALT-T or the TAB key to move to the ‘Hostname’ field.

16. Enter the unique Hostname for this server. All servers MUST have a unique 16-character or less hostname for a clustered installation to install properly. The recommended naming convention is to use DBX, WebX, and DialX where X represents the numerical sequence of that server. For example, the first Telephony server would be Dial1, the second Dial2, etc. The web servers would be web1, web2, etc. Please avoid arbitrary names like ‘Zeus’, ‘Batman’, ‘Lemonade’, etc.
17. Press ALT-D or the TAB key to move to the ‘Domain Name’ field.
18. Enter the Domain Name for this server. The domain name ‘vicibox.local’ can be used if a domain name is not known or not set-up in the current Network Environment.
19. Press ALT-1 or the TAB key to move to the ‘Name Server 1’ field.

20. Enter the primary DNS server for your network. This will typically be the IP address the router if you are using a private IP, or the DNS servers for your ISP if you are not. The ip ‘8.8.8.8’ can be used if the primary DNS server is not known or provided.
21. Press ALT-2 or the TAB key to move to the ‘Name Server 2’ field.
22. Enter the secondary DNS server for your network. This will typically be the DNS server from your ISP. The ip ‘4.2.2.1’ can be used if the primary DNS server is not known or provided.
23. Press ALT-U to change to the Routing screen
24. Press ALT-F or the TAB key to change to the ‘Default IPv4 Gateway’.

25. Enter the Default Gateway for your network. This will typically be the router’s IP if the server is configured with a private IP address or the gateway as provided by the ISP if it’s directly attached to the network.

26. Press ALT-O to select ‘OK’ and save the network configuration. This will cause the network to reload and the changes to become active. It is possible during this step that the network will not reload cleanly. To prevent this issue from causing any problems it is recommended to reboot the server prior to the Phase 2 ViciDial installation.

This project was created to handle and control the flow of outbound call established via cpaas and routed to a particular Asterisk server.

Below functionalities are implemented as part of it :1. outbound call using Asterisk - A connection is established with the Asterisk host on a specified port. Asterisk receives call events on a websocket, through which all the events are routed and are being captured by the call controller application. Based on the type of events, channels are created(one for the agent, one for the customer), and then bridged together to establish a call.
2.  call webhooks - Webhooks to show the progress of calls on an ELK dashboard.

Whenever we initiate a call from cpaas system, it goes on to an Asterisk host - this marks the legA(channel) of the call. Asterisk receives an event (onStasisStart) which is consumed by AsterCallControl over a websocket connection. There’s a ARIWSHelper class which caters to all the events received over the websocket, and from ClickToCall class, we keep on overriding those eventHandlers and write business logic to establish the call. Terminologies of a call : Channel - Two legs of the call - legA and legB are called channels, they represent the two parties, i.e., the agent and the customer respectively, in case of an outbound call.Bridge - The two channels are added to a bridge (created using ARI functions). Once the channels are added, the bridge merges the two channels, and places the call.

Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) runs the Kubernetes management infrastructure for you across multiple AWS Availability Zones to eliminate a single point of failure.
A highly available architecture that spans two Availability Zones.
A virtual private cloud (VPC) configured with public and private subnets according to AWS best practices
In the public subnets, managed NAT gateways is configured to allow outbound internet access for resources in the private subnets.

In one public subnet, a Linux bastion host in an Auto Scaling group to allow inbound Secure Shell (SSH) access to Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances in private subnets. The bastion host is also configured with the Kubernetes kubectl command-line interface for managing the Kubernetes cluster.
An Amazon EKS cluster, which provides the Kubernetes control plane.
In the private subnets, a group of Kubernetes nodes which is hosting different services required for the application.

For the implementation of infrastructure, we are using the following tools:

We are using Terraform for implementing the infrastructure as code. For this purpose, we have created modules required for creating networking, routers, gateways, and the Kubernetes cluster along with the worker nodes. We are using Terraform version 1.1.6 and this has been deployed using Jenkins as a pipeline.

Jenkins has been hosted on our cloud servers which are used for creating pipelines. Using these pipelines, the cloud infrastructure is created first and later different components of the applications are deployed on the Kubernetes cluster.

Sonarqube is being used to perform static code analysis and create reports that aid in finding out the vulnerabilities and also mitigating them. We have hosted our Sonarqube server on the cloud and have been running over our different code repositories.

The goal of Apache Kafka is to solve the scaling and reliability issues that hold older messaging queues back. In Salesken we use Kafka as a Pub-Sub mechanism where Comm Produces Tasks in Kafka and CDR picks up tasks from Kafka on a regular interval which is then utilized by the Analysis Engine.

Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker. In Salesken Redis is being used for persisting user & Organisation details as a cache to make frequently accessed data in memory so that applications can be responsive to users.

Elasticsearch allows us to store, search, and analyze huge volumes of data quickly and in near real-time and give back answers in milliseconds. It's able to achieve fast search responses because instead of searching the text directly, it searches an index. In Salesken Elasticsearch is used widely in storing analysis data and showing it to users in a fraction of a second.

Empathy is one of the most important skills for a sales rep to be successful.

Often confused with sympathy, empathy actually requires perspective-taking. When you are being empathetic, you are doing more than feeling sorry for another person; you are actually trying to imagine the situation from that person's point of view.
There are three different types of empathy, and it's possible to have more than one type at a time:
Emotional empathy - When you feel something because someone else does, this is emotional empathy. You may have noticed this when you cried watching a very sad scene in a movie.

Cognitive empathy - Involving thinking more than feeling, cognitive empathy means putting yourself in someone else's shoes. When you talk to a friend about something that is bothering you and feel understood by that person, it's often because your friend was using cognitive empathy.
Compassionate empathy - This is any kind of empathy that leads to action. When you see someone in need and offer that person some food or money, that is compassionate empathy.

Authentication: The authentication scheme used for the Plecto API is Basic Authentication. This authentication scheme includes sending your username (email) and password along with the request. The employee must have admin access to succeed with most API endpoints.
Required Parameters: There are mandatory keys that must be included in the request body for every request that you send. They are the following: data_source, member, and external_id.
The data_source key requires the unique UUID of a data source. This alphanumeric string can be found in the URL when you open a data source.
member_api_provider refers to the name of your system. In the image below, the displayed system name is "Postman."

member_api_id refers to the member ID of your system. In Plecto, it is displayed under the "External ID" field because the member ID comes from an external system, meaning - yours. The member_api_provider and member_api_id together identify an employee in Plecto.

member_name is the name of the member. This name will be displayed in the "Employee" field in your Plecto data source and can be updated, provided that you use the same member_api_provider and member_api_id values.
OR

member uuid: member uuid requires to have an existing employee profile in Plecto. The member UUID can be found in the URL of an employee page. Go to Organization > Employees and click on the employee name to open their employee page and see the UUID.

The external_id is a number or a string of characters that has to be unique for each registration. It could be something like 123, abc or anything you can think of. This is important as it will be the reference of the created registration. The external ID values in your request body are displayed in the "ID" field in your Plecto data source (see the image below).
If you send a request with the same external ID as you have already used, it will overwrite an existing registration in Plecto and display the new updated information.

Freshsales CRM integration is a bidirectional data syncing process i.e. data insert and update from salesken to freshsales CRM and vice-versa. In this process basically, we are creating and updating tasks at freshsales CRM and pulling data like the user, lead, task, etc. from freshsales to salesken.

Step 1: We provide an integration page to integrate your client’s CRM to Salesken. On the integration page organization needs to fill in the credentials like client id, client secrete, base URL etc. and submit these details. On submit we authorize the credentials and store them into salesken database then we provide access to pull and push data through salesken.

Step 2: After authorization, we will provide mapping functionality where the admin can map the Salesken field to the CRM field and this data is stored in org_crm_mapping table salesken DB and if required create custom fields.

Step 3: Call through salesken dialer once call initiate that time task has been created into the Salesken DB. Take task id and hit the crm_integration API, here before the task creation at CRM we will sync user's or lead's details i.e. if user id or lead id present at CRM then fetch user id or lead id from CRM and update into the salesken DB. After syncing user/lead,  we will check CRM task id is present in the integration_metadata table or not. if present then update that task otherwise create a new entry in the table.
Note: we are extracting both user and lead from single API.

Create Kafka topics:salesken@ronak-shah kafka % kafka-topics --create --topic test-topic --bootstrap-server localhost:9092 --replication-factor 1 --partitions 4 Created topic test-topic.Create Kafka Producer Messages:salesken@ronak-shah ~ % kafka-console-producer --broker-list localhost:9092 --topic test-topic
Create Kafka Consumer for test-topic Producer:salesken@ronak-shah kafka % kafka-console-consumer --bootstrap-server localhost:9092 --topic test-topic --from-beginning

If all is configured correctly, you should see “test local first message”, “test local second message” as soon as Consumer for your topic test-topic is initiated via localhost port 9092. This implies, your local kafka is now ready to act as message broker queue.

There are certain organization level settings, that control the behaviour of users operating and interacting with the platform. Below are further details:

Any individual logged in with Associate role from the organization downloading any reports from any  Reporting page will not receive columns containing Customer Personal Information (Phone Number, Email id)
Any Manager logged in with Manager role in the organization downloading any reports from any  Reporting page will not receive columns containing Customer Personal Information (Phone Number, Email id)

Any Manager logged in with Associate role in the organization trying to use any page on the Salesken portal, will see all fields containing Customer Personal Information (Phone Number, Email id) masked in format ‘xxxx-xxxx-xxxx’

Any Associate logged in with Associate role in the organization trying to use any page on the Salesken portal, will see all fields containing Customer Personal Information (Phone Number, Email id) masked in format ‘xxxx-xxxx-xxxx’

Any Associate logged in with Associate role in the organization trying to make a call, will see the Record option as disabled by default and will not have an ability to toggle the Recording to Active state.

Mapping of Just Call Entity and Salesken Call Entity

Just Call is a dialer where we can make or receive calls. Just Call will store the details of the calls. A Scheduler will be invoked every 30 minutes. Using API we will fetch call details of given time limits/range. Then it will send the call details as a response to the user.
Using API we will fetch the call details from the Just Call of a given time range. Just Call will send call details as a string or object as a response.
This API accepts the following parameters which let me fetch the latest calls which have been placed in the last 10 minutes.
With this base, we try to schedule a cron job on google cloud scheduler. The scheduler calls the API every 10 minutes and fetches the calls which were placed during that time.
Just Call provides stats API so that we can get the Just Call Object and the details of the calls of a certain period.Request Response:​https://justcall.io/developer-docs/#calls

This POC was done to study the behavior of the Freshsales CRM to test the APIs and other CRM related functionality.
This POC is divided into three parts:
Firstly, we will signup and create a trial account into the Freshsales CRM.
Secondly, we will create contact and add task for the newly made contact.
Thirdly, we will test the API available in the developers section of Freshsales API collection for CRM.
Part : I Signup and Creation of trial account
Step 1: Move to Freshsales signup page and create an account. The mail id that is going to be used for signup should be one having organization name in the domain name.
Step 2: After signing up we will be redirected to the dashboard page of the Freshsales CRM.
Step 3: After the successful signing up to the CRM dashboard, next step is to obtain the API token for using the APIs available in the Developer Section.
II : Creation of Contact and Creation of Task

Step 5 : Now after the contact is created we can create task for the newly created contact, we can also create task for the sample available contact. For creating task we can click on the three dots available for editing the  contact, which will open up a dropdown and we need to select add task.
III Fetching the list of task using the API
Step 1. For fetching the list of tasks, first we can go to the API library and then navigate to the list all tasks API. We can use the curl code and test the API.

Step 2: For running the curl code we need to change the token with our API key and we need to replace the domain name with our organization’s domain name. We can also use different filters available in the documentation of the API
Step 3: On testing the curl code on Postman, we get the newly added task in response.

Cueing can be achieved by audio streams from a live phone call over WebSockets in near real-time.
2)Ozonetel should support streaming in the required format.
When a call is initiated Ozonetel should hit “XYZ” API which will return web socket URL in the below format in real-time:-
This API will instruct Ozonetel to fork the audio stream of the current call and send it in real-time over WebSocket to wss://mystream.ngrok.io/audiostream.

This starts the audio stream asynchronously and immediately continues with the next call back API instruction. If there is no instruction, the call will be disconnected. In order to avoid this, provide a call back API instruction to continue the call.

There is a one-to-one mapping of a stream to a WebSocket connection, therefore there will be at most one call being streamed over a single WebSocket connection. Metadata will be provided so that you can handle multiple inbound connections and manage the mappings between the unique stream identifier or streamId.
If communication issues are encountered with your WebSocket server, they will be reported in the Ozonetel Debugger with additional information about the failure.
There are a maximum of 4 forked streams allowed per call. Each track, inbound or outbound, is a forked streaming.
The url attribute accepts a relative or absolute url. On successful execution, a WebSocket connection to the url will be established and audio will start streaming.wss is the only supported protocol.
The url does not support query string parameters. To pass custom key value pairs to the WebSocket, make use of Custom Parameter instead.
Providing a name will allow you to reference the stream directly. This name must be unique per Call. For instance, stop streaming by name.

The track attribute allows you to optionally request to receive a specific track of a call. On any given active call, there are inbound and outbound tracks. Inbound represents the audio received from the call and outbound represents the audio generated by Ozonetel to the call.

However, if you are using an asynchronous Stream by using the <Start> verb, you can request the audio it generates by choosing outbound_track. To receive both tracks of a call use both_tracks. If both_tracks is used, you will receive both the inbound media event and outbound media event.
The statusCallBack attribute takes an absolute or relative URL as value. Whenever a stream is started or stopped, Twilio will make a request to this URL with the following parameters:
The unique identifier of the Account responsible for this Stream.
If defined, this is the unique name of the Stream. Defaults to the StreamSid
One of stream-started, stream-stopped, or stream-error (see StreamError for the message)
If an error has occurred, this will contain a detailed error message.
The time of the event in ISO 8601 format
When a call is ended Ozonetel should hit “XYZ” API which will close the web socket connection.
There are separate types of events that occur during the Streaming life cycle. These events are represented via WebSocket Messages:
Each message sent is a JSON string. You can determine which type of event is occurring by using the event property of every JSON object.
The following messages are sent from Twilio to your application:
The first message sent once a WebSocket connection is established is the Connected event. This message describes the protocol to expect in the following messages.
Defines the protocol for the WebSocket connections lifetime. eg: "Call"
This message contains important metadata about the stream and is sent immediately after the Connected message. It is only sent once at the start of the Stream.
Number used to keep track of message sending order. First message starts with "1" and then is incremented.
The Call identifier from where the Stream was started.
An array of values that indicates what media flows to expect in subsequent messages. Values include inbound, outbound.
An object containing the format of the payload in the Media Messages.
The encoding of the data in the upcoming payload. Value will always be audio/x-mulaw.
The Sample Rate in Hertz of the upcoming audio data. Value is always 8000
The number of channels in the input audio data. Value will always be 1
This message type encapsulates the raw audio data.
Number used to keep track of message sending order. First message starts with "1" and then is incremented for each message.
The chunk for the message. The first message will begin with "1" and increment with each subsequent message.
Presentation Timestamp in Milliseconds from the start of the stream.
A stop message will be sent when the Stream is either <Stop>ped or the Call has ended.
The mark event is sent only during bi-directional streaming by using the <Connect> verb. It is used to track, or label, when media has been completed.
The value specified when creating the mark message to Ozonetel

Send the clear event message if you would like to interrupt the audio that has been sent various media event messages. This will empty all buffered audio and cause any mark event message to be sent back to you.
The SID of the Stream that should receive the mark
Start a new asynchronous MediaStream named "Example Audio Stream". The stream will begin sending messages to the url specified over a WebSocket connection.
Appie and cueing will be connected through web sockets.
There is a one-to-one mapping of a stream to a WebSocket connection, therefore there will be at most one call being streamed over a single WebSocket connection.
There are separate types of events that occur during the Stream's life cycle.

User subscribers impact everything where we show users' data to the managers/admins, create users, create teams, create pipelines, etc. And if we change the narrative of user subscribers, we will have to make changes to relevant places.

The sales manager can subscribe to users either by selecting users or choosing a team. If A Sales Manager subscribes to a team, then all the team members will be subscribed to the manager, not the team itself. A manager can also subscribe to himself.

The sales manager can subscribe to users either by selecting users or choosing a team. If A Sales Manager subscribes to a team, then all the team members will be subscribed to the manager, not the team itself.
A sales associate can not subscribe to any users.
A sales associate can not subscribe to any users

Admin can create a user with either Manager or Associate or both privileges. And a Sales Manager can create a user with only Associate rights. A Sales Associate can not create any users. A User can have at most three roles. Users can have either Admin, Associate, Manager, or all of them. A licensed user can log in to the Salesken platform. Users can exist without a team.
And a Sales Manager can create a user with only Associate rights
A User can have at most three roles. Users can have either Admin, Associate, Manager, or all of them
The creation of a user will not impact ELK and Redis. This ELK and Redis will only impact during the subscription.
While creating a user, there are some required values you have to pass, such as Name, Email, Phone Number, Language, Role, License, etc.
The user object will be similar to the below one.
The Action performed on user details will impact ELK and Redis alongside the Postgres database.
Admin can edit all the users' details. And the manager can edit all the associates' details. And the associate can edit his / her details from the profile page.
Admin can change the role of any user, and a manager can change the role of associate users.
If an associate's role changed to the manager, then the impact will be on the team(he can not be a part of any team) and the user subscriber(now he/she can subscribe to the others)

If a manager's role changed to associate, then the impact will be on the user subscription(he can not subscribe to anyone and will remove all the previous subscriptions) and the team(now he can be the part of the team)
Admin can activate and deactivate all the users of the organization. And a manager can activate and deactivate associates.
This will impact the user(activate will change the is_deleted false, and  deactivate  will change the is_deleted to true)
Admin can provide a license to all the users of the organization. And the manager can provide the license to all the associates.
This will impact the user license(licensing the user will update the license of the user in the user_licence table),
Admin can reset the password of all the users of the organization. and the manager can reset the password of all the associates.
This will impact the user table(update the password provided by the admin/manager)

Admin is the only role that can create a team. While creating a team admin can add as many users as he wants in a team. A user can be added to many teams. You can not have a team with zero users. Users with only Manager roles can not be part of a team.
The creation of a team will not impact ELK and Redis.
While creating a team, there are some required values you have to pass such as Name, Description, Members, etc.
The team object will be similar to the below one.

Admin is the only role that can edit a team. In the edit team, you can remove a user from a team, add a user to a team, edit the team name team description. This will impact the team and group users table alongside ELK and Redis.

Admin is the only role that can play de a team. The delete team will remove all the users from that team and delete that particular team. This will only impact the team and group users table and not on the ELK and Redis.

Anyone with admin privileges can see all the details of the organization, so the admin can not subscribe to anyone. Only the user with manager privileges can subscribe to all the sales associates of the organization.
The subscription page will have two filters (Associates and Teams) in search alongside download and date range.
From the subscription page, you can subscribe to an associate or unsubscribe to an associate.
When a user gets subscribes all the ELK data of all the tasks performed by a user will impact. And Redis data of the manager will also impact the same goes for unsubscription.
You can log in with the sales manager, sales associate, and admin roles from appie-v2 portal.
This API is used to subscribe to user or team
The manager dashboard will show all the distinct teams data of the users he subscribes. and also all the users(manager subscribed) data.
The team data on the dashboard will not depend on wheater the manager subscribes to some of the users of a team or not.
Can users be created by the Sales Manager portal?
Yes, users can be created from the sale manager portal but only with associate privileges.
Can teams only be created by the Admin?
Yes, only the admin can create a team, edit a team and delete a team.
How can I create an Admin role user?
when you create your organization on the Salesken platform. The first user becomes the admin. Admin can be the only one for an organization.
Should a team be an option while creating a user?
No, As only Admin can create a team, add users in a team, and remove users from a team. And a user can be created from the manager portal also.
Should designation be there while creating a user? If yes. Will there be a dropdown for the list of designations? If yes, will we store the multiple designations in organization settings?
Can only admin privileged users can add and remove users from a team?
Will users activate/deactivate will impact caller id assignment?
No, this will make the code implicit. There is a section where you can assign removed caller Ids.
Will users activate and deactivate will impact licensing?
No, Assigning a license should be a separate thing.
Should password reset will directly reset the password to some default keyword or the password provided by the manager/admin? (Not including the working of profile page password reset.)
Reset the password with the new password provided by the manager/admin.
WIll Un-Spam be the part of the user?
No, It should be the part of caller Id management.
Can a manager subscribe to a different manager?
No, a sales manager can not subscribe to a different sales manager.
In the Manager/Admin dashboard, all the user's details will be alongside the team or only those users' details who are not part of any team?
Do I have to subscribe to myself to view my reports?
Every user will automatically subscribe to him/herself. You do not have to explicitly subscribe to yourself.

An Organization can use any CRM for their purpose, we get the data from organization’s choice CRM and store it into our database. Currently we are having only one CRM configuration  for one user which is organization’s default CRM . We can add multiple CRM integration for an User.
If a user has no CRM then user is assigned default CRM of the org. User can choose any CRM ,so that we can push or pull the data from that CRM.

While creating user,  there will be default CRM. User’s CRM can be changed. If there is a specific CRM for a user there will be a mapping between user and that specific CRM (i.e. details). We check for crm_integration_id in istar_user table, if crm_integration_id is null we will fetch organization’s default CRM by user’s organization. If crm_integtartion _id is not null then we will go for the CRM mapped to that user.
There should be an UI somewhere to incorporate these changes  to make automate this functioality.
Appie (could be in integrations pages i.e after or before integrating a CRM we can choose which users to have this CRM mapped to / user maagement).
Get the data of the crm of the user related to the task_id
We use crm_integration table and istar_user to check and update data of crm
In  crm_integration table we get data of organization_id and map it to the CRM .
In istar_user table we check for the crm_intgration_id , if that field is null for particular organization then we assign  that filed to default CRM of that organization.
Particular Organization can be use multiple CRM ,they are not restricted for a single CRM .
To integrate cueing functionality with a third-party dialer.
2)Dialer should support streaming in the required format.
The <Stream> instruction allows you to receive raw audio streams from a live phone call over WebSockets in near real-time.
This TwiML will instruct Twilio to fork the audio stream of the current call and send it in real-time over WebSocket to wss://mystream.ngrok.io/audiostream.

The <Start> verb starts the audio <Stream> asynchronously and immediately continues with the next TwiML instruction. If there is no instruction, the call will be disconnected. In order to avoid this, provide a TwiML instruction to continue the call.
If you'd prefer a synchronous bi-directional stream, you should use the <Connect> verb.

There is a one to one mapping of a stream to a WebSocket connection, therefore there will be at most one call being streamed over a single WebSocket connection. Metadata will be provided so that you can handle multiple inbound connections and manage the mappings between the unique stream identifier or StreamSid.
The url does not support query string parameters. To pass custom key value pairs to the WebSocket, make use of Custom Parameters instead.
Providing a name will allow you to reference the stream directly. This name must be unique per Call. For instance, stopping a Stream by name.

The track attribute allows you to optionally request to receive a specific track of a call. On any given active call, there are inbound and outbound tracks. Inbound represents the audio Twilio receives from the call and outbound represents the audio generated by Twilio to the call.
By default, Twilio always streams the inbound track of a call. When a Stream is started using the synchronous bi-directional <Connect> verb, this is your only option.
The statusCallback attribute takes an absolute or relative URL as value. Whenever a stream is started or stopped, Twilio will make a request to this URL with the following parameters:
There are separate types of events that occur during the Stream's life cycle. These events are represented via WebSocket Messages: Connected, Start, Media, Stop, and the bi-directional only Mark.
There should be a way of instructing the dialer through a webhook or any other way to fork the audio stream of the current call and send it in real-time over a WebSocket URL.
The third-party dialer may support any or all of these parameters.
This is an optional parameter. An object that represents the
Payload should be in this format and Raw mulaw/8000 audio is encoded in base64.

Getting calls from a local number increases the chances of calls getting responded to. To solve this problem an associate can have multiple caller ids and the call will be placed from one of the assigned callerId of that region/country. The associate will have at least One caller ID that will be fixed which will be used for every country.
E.g. Assign four callerIds to every associate -three callerIds of assigned countries and one fixed caller id to deal with customers from other countries.

Every associate may be assigned multiple callerId(s). If the associate gets a lead from a country that matches with any of the country codes in his allocated set of caller ids then the call will be placed with the corresponding country code callerId. If the country code doesn’t match with any of the callerIds country codes then the call will be placed from the “default” caller id for this particular lead.
Multiple caller id needs to be available to be assigned to the sales associate.
On creating user we wouldn’t be providing any caller id by default.
Admin will assign a default caller id to the sales associate created.
If admin wishes he can assign caller id of other countries as well.
Caller id of any country can be assigned or released from sales associate by admin at any time.
When an associate places a call to a lead then the customer’s country code will be checked with entries in the country code column and the call is initiated using the following logic.

If the customer’s country code matches with the associate CallerId country code’s field then the call is initiated from the respective caller id and if it does match then the call is initiated with the “default” caller id assigned to the associate.
Use a “default” caller id to every associate for countries whose country code doesn’t match with the country code added in the field.

Agent with a valid callerId receives the inbound call, a popup opens indicating you are receiving a call which has two options :
Accept → Agent picks up the call, need to replace the HTML contents of the page by inbound_calling.jsp. Rest the calling flow continues similar to outbound call.
Reject / Busy / Not available → Agent needs to get a notification regarding the call. (Follow up task)

Group calling feature that enables the associate (from Associate Dashboard) to engage lead(s) in a much better way.

Unlike regular calls, conference calls is when more than 2 persons are in a single call, where they can talk and  listen to each other. The associate can add/remove participants to/from the conference call.
An associate (individually) can initiate a conference call and further add/remove participants to/from it.
There are many features described in the SDK on how an incoming participant is joining the call. This allows us to modify the ongoing call according to the use cases.
e.g. a participant can be set to be on mute when he enters the call.
For more information on Programmable call please refer to Twilio Programmable Voice
We are using Twilio SDK for conference calling.
The associate will create a call using the Twilio SDK along with certain parameters required to initiate a call.
This call initialized is an empty conference call with a Room Name (confId) which is created randomly.
Participants are added into the Room as the agent connects the call to them. The participant and room name are created in ConferenceServet.java in salesken-backend
Room Name, Caller Id and To are sent as parameters.
The initializeDialer() in sken_conference.js function is invoked when an associate tries to initiate a conference call. This creates an a conference room with the Room Name that is created.
The associate can add participants using the API, conferenceController.java
This is used to add participant to the room (conference)
contact number of the associate with which the call is initiated
Unique room name for the conference call

The conference call is mapped to a unique Twilio application with a unique TwiML App SID. Also the logs of the conference calls made from the associate are logged into the twilio call logs and the errors are logged under the errors tab (if any).
The TwiML response body is also stored for every participant added to the call.
The callerId of the associate should be twilio verified, else he wont be able to make any calls.
During a call can an associate change the type of the call (normal to conference and vice-versa)?
No, an associate can either make a conference call or a normal call.
How does the manager join a conference call?
The ongoing calls that the associate is engaged with are listed on the manger portal. A manager can choose to join the call, provided the associate initiated a conference call.
To know more on the various ways a manager can join a conference call, please refer to:

Hierarchy Tree:  Sample hierarchy tree to understand Hierarchy concept
Subscribers: Subscribers are all those users who can see the user’s reports. The list of subscribers is userIds of all those users recursively above this in the hierarchy tree.
For example in fig 1.1 subscribers of SA7 are TL3, D3, VP2, CRO

Reportees:  All those users whose reports a user can see or simply all those users who come below this user in the hierarchy tree. The list of reportees is userId of users recursively below that user in the hierarchy.
For example in fig 1.1 reportee of VP2 are D3, D4, TL3, TL4, SA7, SA8, SA9, SA10, SA11, SA12
Manager: The user which comes directly above the user in the hierarchy tree.
Cache/ Redis Cache: All the Key Objects like  Organization, Pipeline, Product, Team, User are cached in Redis.
These objects are nested in the User object so there are any changes in any of these objects then the Redis cache of the user needs to be refreshed/updated.

Authentication is the process of recognizing a user's identity. It is the mechanism of associating an incoming request with a set of identifying credentials. The identification phase provides a user identity to the security system. The purpose of Authentication is to identify the user’s credentials and to allow login only if the provided credentials are correct.

Languages supported by signal analysis is only English.
Can we define signal in Hindi OR any supported languages ?
Yes. But right now we encourage only English language to define signals as it is stable.

We  don't define match method. They are the methods by which the signal was caught.

If caught by Milvus then match method can be ‘MILVUS_LSE', 'MILVUS_USE’

This Reports section will contains the details regarding all the calls happens between the agents and the customers.
Reports :- Report page presents post call information in an organized format.

Comparative Analysis :- comparative Analysis page is a report based on the signal coverage comparison between two reps/agents. It shows the coverage in percentage.Coverage :- Ratio of occurrence of signal in percentage in all tasks performed by the reportees of the manager. Formulae - (no. of calls in which the signal was caught / total of calls made by the logged in associate) * 100Success for a signal :- Lead can have 3 statuses i.e. WON, LOST, INPROGRESS .Example :- Suppose total calls made by the logged in associate is 100 and out of which 40 calls having lead status as INPROGRESS , 30 calls having lead status as LOST and 30 calls having lead status as WON and out of 30 WON calls let’s say 15 calls are having LEAD QUALIFICATION as a signal so the success percentage for that signal will be (15/30)*100 i.e. 50% which means 50% of the calls with lead status as WON has lead qualification get caught as a signal.

Bar Chart :- A bar chart or bar graph is a chart or graph that presents categorical data with rectangular bars with heights or length proportional to the values that they represent. The bars can be plotted vertically or horizontally. A vertical bar chart is sometimes called a column chart.
Example JSON Data for the activity_log index

On-Hovering :- On hover over any bar it will show the agent name and coverage of that signal .
Logged in Associate can see the coverage of signals of other reps also and can compare their coverages.
Subscribers idTheir is a must condition to retrieve the data that is semanticSignals.name or emotionalSignals.name should exist and user.id must be equal to the logged in user id.

Note: The Email and mobile should be unique while creating a lead or uploading a lead.
Sync lead from other CRM yet to be implemented.

Lead management helps you view the lead details and comprehend lead information. Here, you can easily add the lead and organize it with your leads in your Salesken account. The lead stats are assigned to each associate separately.

The Sales Manager (SM) Lead page illustrates users' lead data, who report to their subscribers of a definite period. The Sales Associate (SA) Lead page explains the leads assigned to them and others leads if they call them the same lead.
The data shown on the lead stands on hierarchical connections, which indicates that each SM should subscribe to a particular rep to view its data in the lead.
Lead management mainly has six functions: Sort, Upload, Add Lead, Download Lead, Search, Date range.
Learn how to sort and organize the lead list to make it worthwhile for evaluation.
Note: if you have already applied any filter, e.g., Search and Date range filter, you can sort the visible data according.

Ascending is used to sort the data in ascending order - from A to Z alphabetically or from the smallest to the most significant number for numerical data.Descending is used to sort the data in descending order - from Z to A alphabetically or from the largest to the smallest for numerical data.
Performed Date- The Performed date, the date the lead was contacted recently.
Pitch Score - Pitch score of a lead.
Deal Value - Deal value is the value of the deal/lead. You can update the deal value from the lead details page.
Conversations - The number of conversations made to the particular lead.
By default, the data is sorted by the updation of a lead in descending order.

Empty data values are not considered while sorting which means if you sort the data with deal value and in some data points, there is no deal value exists then those will not come top while sorting by ascending order. and if all the data point does not have deal value then sorting will not happen.

The data will be sorted by default in descending order when you sort it; if you wish to sort the data in ascending order, click again on the equivalent filter, then it will appear in ascending order. Concerning the filter URL will update.
There are two ways to add leads to your Salesken account.

Note: Mobile number and email address should be unique. If no email address is passed, the default email address will be unknown-<phoneNumber>@unknown.com. If no name is passed, the default name will be <phoneNumber>.
Note: When a Sales Associate or a Sales Manager adds a lead, its default status is CREATED. And when Sales Associate makes a call the status becomes INPROGRESS.
Note: Mobile number is only required field while creating or uploading a lead
Note: Associates fields shows all the associates which a manager subscribes.
Import leads from different CRMs into your Salesken account and follows up your Salesken account leads. To Upload your old leads into Salesken Account, follow the steps.
If you are storing your lead data in any database application, you will have to save all your leads data into an xlsx spreadsheet.
Note: If you are importing leads from different sources, the leads data of the company and contacts are out of sync.
Need to implement after the release of 2.0.4
To upload lead data, click the Upload button on the lead page. Click on the Upload button will open a page where you can upload an XLSX file.
Ensure the file is in the XLSX format, and the file size is not more the 40MB.
If you stored the lead details in the database, copy them to a spreadsheet or convert them to an XLSX formatted file.
Make a structured data set. Columns names are mandatory. You can refer to Sample FIle to learn more about the columns.
You must enter column names in the excel file. These are the different lead attributes or fields like Name, Company name, Email, etc.
There is some regex validation happening for all the column values. Refer RegEx Validation Section
Drag and drop the file or file you would like to upload to your Leads onto the local machine or click select a file. Locate where you have saved your XLSX. Select the file. Click the open button.
Once you upload the file list of leads, details will display as per the file in the Lead Reports.
In Lead Report, there are three tabs as follows.
Create: In the create tab, you will see all the rows, e.g., lead detail that does not have any errors; in other words, these leads will be created when clicking on Submit button.

Update: In the update tab, you will see all the rows, e.g., lead detail that does not have any errors, but there is already a lead created with the same mobile phone number. When clicking on the Submit button, these leads' data will be updated with the new data from XLSX.

Ignore: In the ignore tab, you will see all the rows, e.g., lead detail, with some errors. You can either fix these errors or ignore these leads. There is also an option to download the leads that has some errors. The error file name is randomly generated. Click on the Save button will not add these leads to your account.
There is an option for searching; you can search with any keywords, e.g., Name, Email, Job Title, etc., in your XLSX sheet.
You can see the number of leads that will be created, updated, and ignored upon submit.
Make sure your data looks like you’d expect it if any columns are misaligned or missing the lead detail. Fix the XLSX file and upload it again. For Sample Excel Sheet.
If the detail makes sure this is checked, Once the list is confirmed, click SUBMIT LEAD button.

You will get a confirmation once the Lead will upload shortly, then click OK. Upload leads may take some time depending on the size. So It’s recommended do not to upload the same file twice till all the leads get uploaded.
Note: Upload lead from XLSX file is an asynchronous process.

Learn how to download your lead data to your local machine.
Note: if you do not have any lead within the Search, Data-Range filter. The Download button will be disabled.

At some point, you need to download and keep your entire lead detail. Whether you're migrating to any other CRM or you'd like to create the backup of your data, we've got you covered. You download all your lead information stored in Salesken.

Download your leads as an XLSX file by clicking the Download Button. The download leads are based on the current filters in place. You will get a confirmation popup for the Download Action Triggered. This is an asynchronous process and this may take time depending on the size of the data. The name of the Excel file will download_Leads-SaleskenReports_<CurrentTimeInMiliSec>.xlsx.
We will send you an email with a downloaded attachment to your registered account.
If you cannot find the email in your inbox, check your spam/junk folder.
Filter the lead data using searching a keyword in the search bar.
Search your lead data with lead name, lead email, lead phone number, lead company name, lead status, and lead source.
Filter the lead data with a Date range filter based on the following time frames.
Note: Apply date range filter on any page, and it will be applied on all the pages.
Lead Page shows the list of the lead. This consists following details of the lead.
Lead Name is the name of a lead. Hovering over the lead name will show lead details such as Lead Email, Lead Phone Number
The lead name is the name of the lead.
Lead email is the email address of the lead. Sales Associate can send a mail by clicking on the email.
Lead Phone Number is the contact number of a lead. Sales Associates can make calls by directly clinking on the phone number.
Start Date is a date when lead was created.
Performed Date, the date the lead was contacted recently.
A Pitch score is a score that tells the won probability of that lead. For this, we have to train a model of all the won lead and lost leads of a product.
Deal Value is the value of the lead. Update the lead value while editing the lead.
Status of the lead. Update the lead status while editing the lead.
Last Call by is the details of the associate who made the last call to that lead.
The conversation is the number of conversations made to the lead.
Details - Click on the Details button will open the lead details page.
The lead page will display all the Lead or Customer few details. To view more information and features about a particular Lead, click the Details button.
This page illustrates the complete information about the leads and his activities performed on that lead.
Start Date was the date when lead was created.
Performed date, the date the lead was contacted recently.
A Pitch score is a score assigned to the agent based on how well he/she has performed in the call compared to a successful conversation on a scale of 0 to 100.
It’s the value of the customer paid for the product or service. Update the lead value while editing the lead.
A number of outbound and inbound calls were made by the agent.
A number of emails have been sent to the lead.
Number of webinar sections happened in between the lead and agent
It could be an agent or a manager, who is associating with the customer or lead. (Agent’s Information)
Contact information of the lead e.g. name, email, and phone number.
All the activities that are performed on the customer. Refer to Activity Log page.
All the advisories associated with the leads.
There are some actions that can be performed on the lead. e.g. Edit lead, mark as won and lost, delete lead and view contacts.

When you close a deal with the customer you mark the status of the lead as WON.

Click on contacts will redirect to the contacts page of that lead. On the contacts page, there is a list of all the contacts of the lead with information such as name, email, phone, job title, created date, etc. Here you can add contacts, edit the contact's details, and delete contacts.
When You want to add contacts in an existing lead you can add by clicking on Add Contacts button on the contacts page.
Here phone number is the only required field.
Make sure that no other lead & contacts are created with the same mobile number or email.
When You want to edit existing contacts in an existing lead you can edit by clicking on the Edit button on the contacts table.
If You have added the wrong information of contacts you can delete the contacts from the lead.
Length of Lead name should be greater than 2 digits and less than or equal to 25.
The length of the Lead’s email should be less than or equal to 120.
The length of the Lead’s source should be greater than 2 digits and less than or equal to 25.
The length of the job title should be greater than 1 digit and less than or equal to 100.
The length of the company’s name should be greater than 2 digits and less than or equal to160.
The length of the city’s name should be greater than 2 digits and less than or equal to 160.
The length of the address should be greater than 2 digits and less than or equal to 160.
The length of the state’s name should be greater than 1 digit and less than or equal to 26.
The length of the country’s name should be greater than 1 digit and less than or equal to 56.
The length of the pin code should be greater than 3 digits and less than or equal to 10.
The length of the URL should be less than or equal to 120.
Deal Value should be greater than or equal to 0.
For Name / Job-Title / Address / Lead Source / Company Name / City / State / Country
Note: All the above fields should have more than three words except for Job-Title, which can have a max of 2 letters, e.g., VP.

Who becomes the actor and owner of bulk uploaded leads?

The owner of all the leads will be the user(who uploads the file irrespective of its designation)'s manager and if the user's manager does not exist then the user Itself becomes the owner. And the actor of all the leads will be the user itself.
What is the difference between owner and actor?

The actor will be the associate of the lead who is making calls to that lead. and the owner will be the manager of an associate if the associate does not have any manager then the owner will be associate itself.

Follow Up :- Follow Up page provides a visual display of the average number of conversations that the rep had with the lead, with the help of a line chart. Follow Up displays the graphical representation of average follow up for the date range specified which represents the number of tasks that were performed on the leads by the reps in the given date range and the average follow ups is calculated accordingly.

Example :- suppose their are 5 lead and their is total 5 conversation with each lead then avg follow up will be {(total no. of conversation)/(no. of lead)} i.e. 5 .so avg follow up is no. of conversation per lead.
Line Chart :- A line chart or line plot or line graph or curve chart is a type of chart which displays information as a series of data points called 'markers' connected by straight line segments.
Lead :- Lead is basically that person to whom an associate(or agent) sells their product.
