Activity Log :- Activity Log report contains the information about the task or call done by the associate to the lead. It contains some details about the lead, agent, type of the call and duration of the call etc. Activity log for associate is for the logged in associate to see their own task details.
This UI of this Page has three sections :-
Filter and Download Section ( Sorting , searching , Date range and Download )

Sort byData can be sorted by 1. Contact name (Agent’s Name)2. Talk Ratio (Agent/customer)3. Type of the call (Inbound/Outbound etc..)4. Direction of the call (Inbound/Outbound)5. Duration of the call6. Pitch Score of the call
NOTE :- Default Sorting is on performed date means the latest task will be shown up.
DownloadThis is simply a button which will download all the details of the reports and will send an email to the associate’s email.
SearchSearching can be done on the Conversation Type , Call Type, Pipelines , Teams , Reps etc..NOTE :- Their will be no search button as searching is happening on change of the input field.
Date FilterTheir is a section above Date Range which shows number of total tasks within the specified date range and filter.
Filtering can be done via date range also.Default selected date will be of today.
Activity Header Card Section ( Based on Type of call )
Inbound Calls :- This will show the number of Inbound calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
App Calls or Outbound Calls :- This will show the number of Outbound Calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
Click-to-dial Calls :- This will show the number of PSTN-PSTN calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
Webinar :- This will show the number of web conference calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
This section will contain card per task performed by the logged in associate, this card will contain details for each task like :-
Lead details like name, email and mobile number.
Type of the Call (Inbound or Outbound etc..)
Status of the Call (COMPLETED or INPROGRESS etc..)
Performed Date means the date when Call happens.
Their is a red arrow in the right top in every card which will redirect the user to the conversations page for that task. ​https://salesken.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SALV2/pages/1891434637

Their is an Activity log pojo defined which has the same schema as the data present in the elastic search which makes easier to map the retrieved data against the pojo.

Their is an activity log dto which is basically used to transfer the data. list of dtos will be returned after taking the data from the activity log pojo and filling the required data to the activity log dto.

FiltersTheir are two APIs , one is for the header card and other is for the activity card which takes all the filters like conversation type , pipeline , stage , rep name , team name , date range , normal search and then elastic search query will be generated on the basis of all the filters which gives the desired result if data is their on ELK.
First one is for Header section This is a GET service which can take multiple Request parameters which will return all the required data retrieving from Elastic Search.
Second one is for Activity CardThis is also a GET service which can take multiple Request parameters which will return all the required data retrieving from Elastic Search.
Third one is for Downloading the reports.This is also a GET service which can take multiple Request parameters

Comparative Analysis :- comparative Analysis page is a report based on the signal coverage comparison between two reps/agents. It shows the coverage in percentage.Coverage :- Ratio of occurrence of signal in percentage in all tasks performed by the reportees of the manager. Formulae - (no. of calls in which the signal was caught / total of calls made by the manager reportees) * 100

Success for a signal :- Lead can have 3 statuses i.e. WON, LOST, INPROGRESS .Example :- Suppose total calls made by all associates under a manager is 100 and out of which 40 calls having lead status as INPROGRESS , 30 calls having lead status as LOST and 30 calls having lead status as WON and out of 30 WON calls let’s say 15 calls are having LEAD QUALIFICATION as a signal so the success percentage for that signal will be (15/30)*100 i.e. 50% which means 50% of the calls with lead status as WON has lead qualification get caught as a signal.

Bar Chart :- A bar chart or bar graph is a chart or graph that presents categorical data with rectangular bars with heights or length proportional to the values that they represent. The bars can be plotted vertically or horizontally. A vertical bar chart is sometimes called a column chart.
Date FilterFiltering can be done via date range only…
Chart Specs :- The chart compares the coverage of signals for every reps and success, with the help of a bar chart. Their will be separate chart per signal.
For the Bar ChartThis is a GET service which can take startDate ,endDate , reps and teams as Request parameters which will return all the required data retrieving from Elastic Search.

Authentication is the process of recognizing a user's identity. It is the mechanism of associating an incoming request with a set of identifying credentials. The identification phase provides a user identity to the security system. The purpose of Authentication is to identify the user’s credentials and to allow login only if the provided credentials are correct. On Successful authentication following things happen:-
Users can log in to the Salesken Platform.
User’s Id is recognized and User Object is fetched from Backend(Redis/Postgres) using Id and saved to the session.
The user is redirected to the manager/associate dashboard based on the role of the user.

Auth0 is a 3rd Party Authentication Service that is a flexible, drop-in solution to add authentication and authorization services to our applications. By Using auth0 we can avoid the cost, time, and risk that come with building our own solution to authenticate and authorize users.
Auth0 provides simple ways to integrate Social Signins, IP/Geo-restrictions,  Brute force attack preventions, Send Welcome Emails, Forgot Password Emails, and many more.

By default, users will not be asked to log in again and will have a persistent cookie stored locally. This will affect all sessions managed by Auth0. Learn more.Inactivity timeout - 4320 mins - 3 daysUsers will be asked to log in again unless they are active within this period (max. 3 days). Read more about this here.Require log in after * - 10080 mins - 7 daysRegardless of the activity, users will be forced to log in after the period (max. 30 days). Read more about this here.

Signal Analysis :- Signal analysis is the summary of all the signals caught during all the tasks performed by all the associates.
Signals :- Signal is the representation of state in a call (or any task) which summarizes the part of that task.

Coverage :- Ratio of occurrence of signal in percentage in all tasks performed by the associate. Formulae - (no. of calls in which the signal was caught / total of calls made by the associate) * 100Instance :- Instance for a signal means total number of call in which that signal get caught.
Semantic Signals :- The meaning of SEMANTIC is of or relating to the meanings of words and phrases
Emotion Signals :- These signals are detected by our Artificial Intelligence engine which has some emotional values.

Correlation :- The correlation page helps us to analyse the relationship between the different signals (semantic and emotion) and also helps us count the instances and coverages of one signal inside the other.
Heat Map :- A heat map (or heatmap) is a data visualization technique that shows magnitude of a phenomenon as colour in two dimensions.
Signal to observe:- The signal which we need to observe in the call like greet, price etc.
Signal to correlate:- The signal which we want to correlate with the signal to observe.
Instance:- Is the number of count of a call  which has a signal to correlate (objection, introduction.. etc) in the total calls(number of call which has signal to observe).
Coverage:- It is in percentage calculated by using  (instance/total number of calls)*100
Example 1If a sales manager A wants to see the tasks of a sales associate B then A must have to subscribe B, then B will be the reporte of A.

Example 2A - managerB - managerC - associateB subscribed C and A subscribed B then B and C are the reportes of A , Now A can see the task of C along with B . Here A didn't subscribed C directly but A can see all the tasks details of C means indirectly C is also reporting to A also along with B.

On-Premises: In an on-premises environment, resources are deployed in-house and within an enterprise’s IT infrastructure. An enterprise is responsible for maintaining the solution and all its related processes.

SaaS: Software as a service (SaaS) allows users to connect to and use cloud-based apps over the Internet. Common examples are email, calendaring and office tools (such as Microsoft Office 365). SaaS provides a complete software solution that you purchase on a pay-as-you-go basis from a cloud service provider.
For the SaaS Deployments, we will be utilizing functionalities of Kubernetes.

Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration platform designed to automate the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. Kubernetes makes it easy to deploy and operate applications in a microservice architecture.
Logging we can manage with the help of Kibana or Cloudwatch.
Kibana is a free and open frontend application that sits on top of the Elastic Stack, providing search and data visualization capabilities for data indexed in Elasticsearch.
Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring and management service that provides data and actionable insights for AWS, hybrid, and on-premises applications and infrastructure resources.
For Monitoring, we will be using Prometheus with Grafana dashboards.

Prometheus is a monitoring solution for storing time-series data like metrics. Grafana is multi-platform open-source analytics and interactive visualization web application. It provides charts, graphs, and alerts for the web when connected to supported data sources.
1. All System-level Metrics: RAM/CPU Usage, Instance Downtime,
2. Kube-API Metrics: Kubernetes exposed Metrics any Pending Deployment
3. All Internal Application-level Metrics ( if Exposed ).

As we are Moving with Microservices, we will have Docker Images in place with us. These Images have been passed with Multiple Testing Environments such as dev, QA, Production so the error rate will be very less.
We will be utilizing docker swarm for On-premise deployments.

Docker swarm is a container orchestration tool, meaning that it allows the user to manage multiple containers deployed across multiple host machines. One of the key benefits associated with the operation of a docker swarm is the high level of availability offered for applications.
Logging and Monitoring of On-Premise deployments will be based on Customers.

Analysis reflects the insights of a sales call.  Analysis reflects the signals being caught in a conversation be it webinars, telephonic calls or manual uploads by speech transcription of the audio provided, depending on the user’s language preference and eligibility for getting task analyzed. Helps the user to identify the rights and wrongs done in a particular conversation and in turn helping the user to find the best way to approach the lead or to grab the deal.
Signals : Signal is the representation of state in a call (or any task) which summarizes the part of that task.
In Salesken we have two types of signals:

Semantic signals: Semantic signals are predefined words or phrases which are detected by our analysis engine during the task to extract some meaning from the task. These signals are defined by the sales manager during creation of the product.
Emotion signals: These signals are detected by our Artificial Intelligence engine which has some emotional values.
Journey to reflect the post call insights on basis of the organization’s pre-defined architecture.
Catches various aspects of the conversation including quality of the conversation, interest of the lead, etc.

Analysis reflects the signals being caught in a conversation be it an inbound call, outbound call, proxy call, webinars or manual uploads by speech transcription of the audio provided depending on the user’s language preference and eligibility for getting task analyzed or not.
Reflects the talk ratio, agent amplitude, customer amplitude and call duration of the call.
Reflects the analysis score i.e. what is the probability of grabbing the deal or interest shown by the lead towards the deal.
The task must contain a valid audio. Example: ”https://storage.googleapis.com/istar-static/aes256encryption(taskId).wav”
Sum of call duration for a user for that month should not exceed the user analysis limit as per defined in organization's configuration.
There should be an all around mapping from task to pipeline to signal generated.

Task must have an actor → actor must be in a team → team must be connected to a pipeline → pipeline must be connected to a product → product must have signals associated with it → product signals should have their generated signals.
Task’s user must have a valid language preference.
Signals are only calculated if conversation duration is greater than 59 seconds.
Indexing of signals should be present at milvus for semantic matching of signals.
Called from mis/comm after a proxy call ends.
Organization List → select a organization → task List → select a task.

(audio length / ( the size of an audio frame *  number of frames within a second))

If any snippet in analysis object contains Hindi characters, then those snippets are converted to English.
This part of analysis analyze the Json object and tries to find the signals corresponding to the snippets of the object.

Task’s actor → team associated with actor → pipeline associated with the team → product associated with corresponding pipeline→ Signals associated with the corresponding product→ Signal generated corresponding with the associated signals.

Remove signal caught and stats: Here we delete the pre existing entries of signals for the task. entries are deleted from sales_user_task_signal table and also the Json array of signals in analysis object is emptied.
Relevant signals are found out for the task upon which snippets will be Semantically/Regex matched.
Score: confidence/cosine similarity provided by milvus between snippet and signal. If caught by ExactMatchengine then the score is 1.
matchMethod: Method by which the signal was caught for that particular snippet. Methods can be ‘MILVUS_LSE’, ‘MILVUS_USE', 'REGEX’.
signalName: The name of the signal that was caught for the snippet.
signalValue: Value of the signal by which the snippet was semantically matched.

Exact Match Signal: Signal values are regex matched with snippets and if snippets contains a part of signal value then that signal corresponds to that snippet and we add it to signals array or that particular snippet.
Match method in signal object is set to ‘WordMatchExact'.
IBM Watson service is used to catch emotions being portrayed by a particular snippet.
List of emotions that are being analyzed and caught by Watson service:
It catches emotions as per defined in the product signal.
Milvus service is used for sematic matching of snippets and signals.
Indexing of signals is already present into milvus.
All the signals are added to snippet if semantically matched and if cosine similarity is greater than the threshold defined for that particular signal in product_signal table.
Match method in signal object is set to ‘MILVUS_LSE' or ’MILVUS_USE' depending upon the encoder that semantically matched that snippet and signal.
Invalid or wrong signals are being cleaned from the analysis object returned from the milvus after matching snippets with signals.
If the signal in product signal table is not active (i.e. product_signal.is_active = false) then that signal is removed from that snippet.
If engine of the signal in product signal table is ‘WordMatchExact' and signal caught match method is different than 'REGEX’ then that signal is removed from that snippet.
Match type is by which speaker(agent/customer/BOTH) should this signal belong to.
If the match type of a signal defined in product signal is not 'BOTH' and doesn’t match the snippet speaker then that signal is removed.
If the score of the signal provided by the Milvus * 1.375 is smaller than the threshold for that signal defined in product signal then that signal is removed.
Match Method is MILVUS_USE → score smaller than 0.51 → removed.
Match Method is MILVUS_LSE → score smaller than 0.65 → removed.

Duration Constraint implies where in time domain that signal should be caught. Example, Greeting signal should be caught only in first two minutes of the conversation. so duration constraint for greeting signals should be FIRST_TWO_MINUTES.

A sales pipeline can help you visualize your sales process. It will show you where in the sales funnel all your deals are, where deals are stalling and which sales activities are bringing in the most revenue. It adds a layer of accountability and makes goals easier to achieve by breaking the sales process down into small, trackable tasks.

In other words, Pipeline  is a linear sequence of specialised modules or process. It is the set of user defined stages, for a particular product of an organisation . Every sales associate should follow the stages, which are defined in the mapped pipeline of their team based on the sales cycle. Architecturally pipeline has a few stages and the tasks and leads can be mapped to pipelines. Tasks being mapped to a pipeline (via stage) indicate that the task was performed when the lead was in that stage.Lead being in a certain stage of a pipeline indicate the progress of that lead in the funnel.Functionally pipeline serve 2 purposes for our internal product functioning:
Every sales associate should follow the stages, which are defined in the mapped pipeline of their team based on the sales cycle.
We define what signals to catch in what activities (tasks) via user → team → pipeline → product route.
Pipelines are also crucial in identifying which stage corresponds to a win and lost and become a part of our recipe for lead scoring modules.
There should be an all around mapping from pipeline to product (for product signals) and pipeline with team.
Team/s must be connected to a pipeline → pipeline must be connected to product/s → product must have signals associated with it → product signals should have their generated signals.

We have entered 10 sentences in triggered words then if we pronounce 6 sentence the cue will caught or no?

The cue will get caught if any of the ten sentences are spoken and the speech to text engine detects it with some accuracy and if there is some variation then the neural search engine detects it within a certain threshold.
What is the accuracy of this system and what is the acceptance criteria?
We need to add some examples of audio files and configuration to orchestrate how functionally the system can work. Let’s do it here.
How many characters limitations in name field while creating and editing cues?
how many word limitations in Trigger field while creating and edit cues?

Cues have types which can be Genric/ FAQ etc. Conceptually FAQ is specific to a particular script so its derived from the knowledge base of that specific account/ organization/ product. Whereas Generic cues are pre-configured in SalesKen platform and just need activation. For example something like Banter can be Generic but something like Details of Pricing will be FAQ.
How many cues can be added to product?

Broadly this can be a number as high as possible. The only limitation is that the trigger phrases need to be distant from each other. So if we see them in a grid of sorts they should not be intersecting. Visually like this:
Can we have a product without adding cues?
Yes the system doesn’t stop you from doing that however the expected behavior of cueing engine then will not be working if there is only one product mapped to the user via team-> pipeline.
When we give the numeric numbers in the triggered field what should the customer pronounce?
Out of the box the speech to text engine returns results like so: i have ten thousand rupees in my.
i have ten thousand rupees in my.
So we need to specify in words what we want to be detected. More details on entity validation and constraints here.
If we give the hyper link in content field then are we able to click that link while call is going one?
Yes we support HTML in our cue answers and questions. So things like anchor tags can be added. For example:
If we add a website in the triggered words when costumer pronounce that website will that cue be caught?

So barring special characters as discussed in point 8, another challenge is abbreviation. Out of the box this feature does not work. So I cannot for example say FAO and expect the system to catch it against a configured trigger-word FAO.
Can we able to give accented characters and special characters in trigged words?
No, as discussed above special characters, abbreviations, numbers, accented characters etc are not supported, more details on entity validation and constraints here.
What is result showing in top left is total numbers of cues or total number of trigger words?
So its there on top right like 19 records found is the number of cue cards which have been configured for that particular product.
if we have same trigger word for 2 cues which will be caught?

Currently we are not stopping this from happening so we can configure the same trigger words for 2 cue cards in the product or 2 cue cards in multiple products with the same (similar) trigger words. What this will lead to is the same trigger word triggering multiple cues and they will be shown consecutively. Refer to the diagram in point 7 that is how an ideal trigger word configuration be for the system to operate without surprises.
At a platform level we handle various types of unhygienic or unexpected inputs accidentally supplied by users while interacting with various input areas across multiple interfaces in the product.
We perform backend and front end checks to ensure that such accidental inputs can be handled.

Every entity has a metadata configuration which is basically a JSON object stored in some document based storage which can also be different for different accounts/ organization. The validator factory picks up the metadata definition and validates the input to give a pass/ fail with an appropriate reason. The metadata schema should handle the following scenarios and
A few use cases and scenarios that can be handled are:
SQL Injection: This can be a deliberate attack into our system
HTML injection: This can happen while copy pasting from multimedia links
JNDI Injection: Yet another attack which can attempt to hijack our system
Javascript Injection: To affect the downstream pages that may use the input values affecting their
CSS Injection: Can affect the design of the pages downstream
Empty inputs or just white spaces need to be handled accordingly or can lead to unexpected feedback
Certain fields need to be unique across the tenant/ product like email, name, phone etc
Can affect the downstream page interfaces to look weird or broken
Can also affect CRUD if the datastore has restrictions
Multilingual and multi-script inputs like accented characters, smileys etc.
Notifications is a micro-service which can be called from any application. Notification can be triggered for a bunch of things:
Event triggers (when: Event initiated, on going, event ends, error initiating an event)
Below is a generic flow of this micro-service:
User logs in → FCM token is generated → FCM token tells which device/application user is on → notification micro-service sends the notifications to the user’s device/application

When a call is initiated by a rep then their manager gets the notification informing them that a call has been initiated
When a lead is marked lost or won by an associate then their manager gets this as notification
When a user misses an inbound call and the call goes to voicemail
Daily not being hit SLA 2 hours before the Day ends
When a daily/ weekly signal achievement goal is not met or met

We are building CRM Org level conf adapters in upcoming Integration Sprints. These adapters are made to support any Org specific connector configurations for us to execute the corresponding SK Task onto the corresponding CRM.Dialer at the end of the call/event should be calling a service to trigger the CRM Task. This task should be triggered from scheduler at regular frequency. Scheduler will execute the task from the Integration Service. This Service then pulls DB for the TaskMap via the Salesken task ID.

Post receiving the taskMap for that particular SK Task ID, we want to execute the corresponding CRM for that TaskMap where the task would then be executed/processed. We wanted to generalize task creation irrespective of the Org confs for that Org for that CRM. Hence CRM Connector layer would perform two way communication with the Org Connector and then in the final step, the corresponding task would execute on the CRM. In the last step SaleskenResponse Object is what would need to be returned to the callee. Failed scenarios for CRM failed events must be rerun via some message/events queues to avoid any manual human intervention.Here is the preliminary layout for easy consumption. This HLD decouples Org Connector from communicating with CRM directly. This allows independent project/design for Org Conf/Mappings w.r.t. the actual CRM write/update operation.

CRM is a technology for managing all our customer’s company relationships and interactions with their customers and their potential customers. The goal is simple: Improve business relationships. A CRM system helps companies stay connected to customers, streamline processes, and improve profitability.
When people talk about CRM, they are usually referring to a CRM system, a tool that helps with contact management, sales management, productivity, and more.

A CRM solution helps our customers focus on their organization's relationships with individual people — including customers, service users, colleagues, or suppliers — throughout their lifecycle with their customers, including finding new customers, winning their business, and providing support and additional services throughout the relationship.

While Salesken itself offers a robust out of the box CRM, many of our customers already have a subscription of the many major CRMs available in the market with workflows configured for the same. So, to avoid our customers the friction and pain of changing their workflows, we provide them with the facility to sync data from their existing CRM to Salesken and vice versa. It allows customer the choice to use their CRM while using our/their own dialer while making use of Salesken services. The customer can even mix and match flows according to their liking with the help of our customized sync flows . All of this makes for a hassle free customer experience.
Check if task id exists in database
Check if there is a corresponding user id to the task in the database or salesforce
Check is there is already a corresponding task in CRM created beforehand
The CRM integration resides between the dialer application and the CRM systems employed by our clients
The project is built to sync Salesken systems with other miscellaneous CRM systems
Whenever a task (other entities coming) is created on either one system, they should reflect in the other
It is not a real time system but is rather designed to provide eventual consistency
The goal of the system is to ensure a consistent experience for the agents regardless of whether they use our backend or the CRM of the company’s choice
The Dialer makes an  HTTP GET request to the CRM API with the taskId as a parameter
The controller calls an integration service which gets all details relevant to the task (this includes lead details, sales contact person details and istar user details)

The integration service calls upon a connector provider which returns a connector based on the user id and/or organization id.  A connector basically maps data from our database into the CRM of the particular organization. Currently we use an abstract factory pattern to do this i.e. ConnectorProvider → CRM Connector Factory → Organization Specific CRM Connector
The Connector maps the task details into a JsonObject and posts it to the CRM
Depending on the validity of our own data (no missing fields etc) and the response from CRM, we give a response back to the dialer
We return a beautiful 200 response to the dialer
Task and Lead will be synced to CRM and Salesken
In case it’s a 400 response we return it back to client
If it’s a 500 response caused by the downtime on part of database or CRM, we push it onto Kafka to process till complete
in case of any other failure scenario will return a proper message and code to our service consumer

Manager portal has a page called Call Barging which actually is made for the manager so that Managers can listen, whisper or barge into live conversations happening on SalesKen.

Barge: Barging means that the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant. Both the parties (sales rep and the customer) can hear what the manager is saying  and the manager can hear what both of them are saying.

Listen: Listening means that the manager can either join the conference as a muted participant or just stream the ongoing call to their browser so that the manager can just listen to the ongoing conversation but not be able to say anything.
Whisper: Whispering means that the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant but only the sales rep can hear what the manager is saying.

Barging and Whispering can only work if the call is a conference call , so for the purpose of Barging/ Whispering the call must be a conference call and this should be configured at a user level and the associate should have initiated a conference call not a normal call.
If the call is being streamed through the SalesKen’s real time Cueing API then just Listening will be enabled , barging is not coming in the picture .

Basically  making a conference is something which is to be implemented in calls by adding participant into that ongoing call. If the call which is initiated is a conference call then adding a participant to that ongoing call means the call is now taking place between the Manager, an Associate and the Lead . So when we will make a conference call there is something called room name which is regenerated , this room name will help us to add a participant in that call . At first room generated will be empty that means at the initial point only  Associate will be present in that room .After that adding of participant will be started .
The  Call Barging page gives the information  of the ongoing call of the Associates who are subscribed under him.
In this page the details  which are represented under him are
Start time (from what time the cl is being started )
These information is provided to the Manager for the understanding that which Associate is on the  ongoing call with which lead and from when.
Features which are present in his page are
This highlighted feature is called Barging . Barging means that the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant.

This is one of the added feature in the Call_Barging page , in this  feature if the Manager clicks on the Barge button then he will be able to join the  ongoing call which is taking place between the Associate and the Lead. As the  start time is already provided  in the UI then he  will be able to see the details and can analyze about the time from what time the call is started .
When the  Barge button is being clicked the Manager will also join the ongoing call as a  conference participant and now the  call is  taking  place between  the Manager, Associate and the Lead.

For the Call Barging feature which is there for the Manager is only possible if the call is a conference call .If the call is not a conference call then this feature will not work .  This should be configured at a user level and the associate should have initiated a conference call not a normal call.

This highlighted feature is known as Listen .  Listening means that the manager can either join the ongoing call  as a muted conference  participant or just stream the ongoing call to their browser so that the manager can just listen to the ongoing conversation but not be able to say anything.

For the Listening  feature which is there for the Call_Barging page , is possible when the ongoing call which is taking place between the Associate and the Lead should be a conference call and the Manger will join the call as a  muted conference participant but not be able to say anything.
This Listening  feature can also be implemented by real time APIs in that only listening will be enabled. API implementation should be done for this feature .

This highlighted feature is known as Whisper. This feature will allow the Manager to interact but only with the Sales_Associate .  Manager wants to speak anything between the call , he can speak but the conversation will be only between the Manager and the Associate , customer will not be involved in this . Customer cannot hear manager.

For the Call Whispering  feature which is there for the Manager is only possible if the call is a conference call .If the call is not a conference call then this feature will not work .  This should be configured at a user level and the associate should have initiated a conference call not a normal call.

At a core level we have user entity. This document will have the considerations for its infra, design and usage.
We want to have modularity across all the microservices with respect to our core entity usage.
User has a list of reportees’s user id and not the whole object itself, we did this to make the user entity not recursive and small
The manager on the other hand is a whole object but not recursively having managers all the way to the top

Should we have the hierarchy tree as a part of the user object? Right now we are not having this because of the size and complexity. Team Owner is a debt we are carrying from the past. The support team to show reports to a given manager today doesn’t necessarily change the hierarchy rather they just make that manager as the owner of the team the reps are in. Post in general:Post successfully adding a new team member, that user can act as Sales Associate or Sales Manager persona on Salesken Webapp. This then exposes the user to start using calling functionality, generating call reporting functionality etc Teams are the basic structure to manage Sales Pipeline for our customers (Organizations). Accidental delete operation on a team would automatically soft delete all the users within that team. Post successful purposeful delete operation disables any dialer calling for all the users from that affected team. Same is the outcome if a given team member is deleted from any specific team.

Delete team and team members is an extremely high impact activity for any Organization. An appropriate backend restore backend operation would need to be performed if there was any accidental deletion.

Micro-service based backend API application that Live streams any internet call over VOIP  of any dialer through Salesken CRM(Appie) App  to Cueing engine.
Call must be an Internet call over VOIP. Does not support proxy or PSTN calls
User who initiate the call must have a valid VOIP number/caller Id to make the call
Inbound server (APPIE) and outbound server (Cueing Server) must be up and running for successful Stream processing.
This service will sit  between the VOIP calling APP and Cueing engine. It will have no UI and will only talk through APIs
Call is initiated from APP which calls Streaming server API to connect call and start live streaming to Cueing Engine.

The Open Source Telephony Recording and Retrieval System. The project currently supports recording voice from VoIP SIP, Cisco Skinny (aka SCCP), raw RTP and audio sound device and runs on multiple operating systems and database systems. It can record audio from most PBX and telephony systems such as BroadWorks, Metaswitch, Asterisk, FreeSwitch, OpenSIPS, Avaya, Nortel, Mitel, Siemens, Cisco Call Manager etc.
The Oreka system consists of a combination of the following services
OrkAudio: this is the audio capture background service. It supports VoIP, TDM and Sound Device based recording.
OrkTrack: this service centrally tracks activity on the entire system and logs recordings to any popular SQL database.
OrkWeb: this service is the web interface accessible via any standard compliant web browser. It relies on the Tomcat web server.
OrkRfb: this is the screen capture background service. It relies on the RFB protocol used in VNC.
This will take care of call management and its full life cycle.
Real-time media streaming over an RTMP endpoint that can be played using any player supporting the RTMP stream.
The feature would be available on-demand and can be enabled/disabled using an HTTP API.
It can be enabled/disabled based on the SIP-Call UUID.
Each call would have a unique RTMP URL while streaming, which would be provided in the enable/disable HTTP call.
There would be no transcoding done by the streaming service, and the receiver would have to transcode if any.

Orkaudio provides a Filter Interface. A Filter is a black box that takes media chunks as input and produces media chunks as output. It can be translating between two encodings (codec) or just procession the signal. Implementation for Filter can be written and plugged in via Orkaudio's configuration file.

LiveStreamFilter is an implementation of Orkaudio's Filter Interface. It captures the incoming audio chunks, processes them to stereo stream chunks, and ingests them to an RTMP server. For every live call, an object of LiveStreamFilter is instantiated. The RTMP server then exposes a unique RTMP URL [rtmp://:/live/] for each call that can be used to live-stream audio on any RTMP-supported player.

Cueing Service”  works in synergy with “Deepgram Service(ASR)”  and “Semantic engine”  to provide similar words  from the already existing  knowledge base present in  “Milvus database“.
1st layer in above architecture. Takes raw voice streaming data as input and sends to deepgram service for ASR(automatic speech recognition).

In this feature user and lead can send SMS to each other.

The user should have a Twilio phone number as either their primary call id (istar_user.caller_id) or have that as a secondary caller id (user_callerid.callerid and user_callerid.is_secondary_caller_id = true). This needs to be done at user management level.
This phone number procured via Twilio should have URL → http://app.salesken.ai/sms/receive  when a message comes in as a webhook.

In lead list name of the actor and organization name is visible.
At right end of the name last activity time period is shown and below that number of SMS are unread are shown as a notification.
Name of the lead actor, his active or inactive status along with phone number is shown at head.
Sent SMS are shown at right in box below it and received SMS are shown at left of the box.

At below there is attachment button at left to send attachments and chat box is present. At right side of the box send button is present to send the SMS written. Send button will be disabled if you want to send SMS to outside US number.
Lead list is shown as per latest SMS sent. Show leads which have been sms'd upon recently followed by recently created leads.
If a file is attached then an MMS is sent

When the send button is clicked a task  is created of type SALES_SMS_TASK with direction as outbound and call_status pooled. The id of the SMS provided by Twilio should be stored in call_sid field of the task.
This task is mapped against the contact person and lead which was selected from the Lead List to whom the SMS/ MMS is to be sent
Twilio is being used as the primary SMS/MMS provider
Once the SMS/MMS is sent to the user, a statusCallBack link will be hit, to update the call_status of the task from pooled to delivered.
The SMS will be analyzed also and showed it on the report of the user.
On the click of a SMS type task the SMS page is opened with q={phone_number} which will be respected by the page when it loads so that the right history is opened.
The CRM hook will also be called and SMS type activity gets logged in Salesforce, Zoho, LeadSquared accordingly.

User can send and receive SMS only if the number is a Twilio phone number. SMS/MMS can be sent only to US phone number and cannot be send to outside US number. We should do this check on the page load and if this check fails then we need to show an error message saying that the phone number mapped as caller id to the user cannot be used to send SMS and a new number should be provisioned from user management for this user to send SMS/MMS.
Whenever a SMS is received on any Twilio number provisioned from the application then the webhook will be hit.
The webhook does 2 things : Identify the user and identify the lead.
If we fail to do user identification then an event is logged for the support/ superadmin to monitor and understand.
If we fail to do lead identification then just a notification of type SMS received is sent to the user identified.
If the user and the lead is  identified:
uniquely then the SMS is forwarded to the user mobile sending a link onto clicking which the chat is opened directly and mention in the message that it's just a FYI message and must not be replied.
Also a task of type  SALES_SMS_TASK with direction as inbound and call_status pooled. The id of the SMS provided by Twilio  should be stored in call_sid field of the task.
When the forwarded SMS is received by the user then the call_status is updated to delivered.
While creating task we sent this data to our DB-
Entity:name : Name  (Name of the Lead)
description : message body/text (SMS/MMS sent to lead)
actor: user ID  (User ID of the associate given by Twilio)
start_date: Created At (Time when the first SMS/MMS sent/received)
end_date: Updated At (Time when the last SMS/MMS sent or received)
task_type : 'SALES_SMS_TASK' ( It shows that task created is of the type SMS/MMS)
lead_id: leadID ( Assigned ID of the lead )
sales_contact_id: Lead ID (Phone number of the lead)
call_sid: MessageSID ( foreign key received from twilio)
Tags : Shows unread / Read status ( It shows if the message received is read by associate or not)
Telephone_provider: ‘TWILIO’  (Telephone provider from where we are interacting with lead)

What if no data is found in CRM or the user who is the owner of the lead which is found in the CRM is not present in our system.
What if no active user is found by this caller id.
What if multiple users were found? Log a notification to all managers and let them know that an inbound SMS was not found for anyone. Do not create a task in this scenario.

This section gives a scope description and overview of everything included in this SRS document. Also the purpose, for this document is described and a list of new features and definitions are provided.
The purpose of this document is to present a detailed description of version 2.0.4. It will explain the purpose and features of the 2.0.4.
Auth0 : Auth0 is used for user authentication and authorization in v2.0.4

Audit logs : The Audit Logs are added in v2.0.4 for associates. It is the representations of the logs of User CRUD operations, where the associates can check only the changes done by them for their own profile.

SMS with Media functionality : The SMS are added in v2.0.4 for the associates. The SMS functionality enables an associate to connect to a lead through text  based media. The media can also be shared over the chat.

Multiple Language Support : The purpose of the multiple language support feature is that, the user will be able to use accented characters for setting up their username i.e. foreign names will be supported.

Default calling by Plivo : When a new user is created for any organization in Super Admin the default calling service assigned to the user is Plivo. The advantage of assigning Plivo is that there is no caller id verification required and the user’s contact number will be shown as from number during the call.

Comparative Analysis Report : The Comparative Analysis Report is added in v2.0.4 for associate. Comparative Analysis Report shows the graphical representation of the signals which are analyzed from a call recording. The associate can compare his data with any other associate present in his team.
Hubspot Integration: This feature is used to integrate hubspot CRM for organization.

Billing module - The subscription and billing module provides functionality to Sales Manager to purchase subscription plans ie. licenses for their organization, directly from their dashboard according to their need. Likewise, the billing portal in super admin provides admin to administer, purchase, extend subscription plans for particular organizations. Currently, There are 3 subscription plans, each divided into monthly and annual divisions -i. Silverii. Goldiii. Platinum

In the current scenario, we are passing all secrets during Build time, which is not feasible as the build will be created and used only for a single purpose. What if we pass secrets at run time so that a single build can be used multiple times with different variables.
Currently, we are managing secrets in GitHub Repositories, That is vulnerable as secrets will be shared with everyone who has access to the GitHub repository.

Put All Secrets in Environment, so that whenever an application is deployed the particular app will get secrets from the respective Environment.                                                                                                                                           Eg. String environmentVariable = System.getEnv("environment_variable_name");
Put all secrets in AWS secret Manager and get secrets from there.
If Load running on AWS only then It will be very useful else the data needs to be traveled from one to another Environment.
Problems with rate limits, although that is a problem more generally with AWS.
There is a cost associated with each secret stored in AWS.
We will use some specific Variable Names for this, For Eg.
Here we will add Properties that are common across all applications, If Properties which are not vulnerable and we can pass through ENV variables or we can put them in the GitHub repo only.

Virtual Audio Cable is a software product based on WDM multimedia driver that allows a user to transfer audio streams from one application to another. Any application is able to send an audio stream to the input side of a "virtual cable" while a corresponding application can receive this stream from the output side. Since all transfers are made digitally, there is no loss in sound quality
So after installing the VAC Windows application, we were able to stream the audio from an mp3 file to a client (Audio Repeater )

But in order to send the stream to cueing server , we need to convert the stream into raw PCM (bytes) so that we can send it to the cueing service , just like whttps://github.com/dynopii/pyvirtualaudiocablee are doing in case of Twilio Calls.
Since we don’t have any way to customize the Windows App, we are looking towards an open source alternative to this (i.e. ​https://github.com/dynopii/pyvirtualaudiocable )
Developer has to  own the quality of code they write .Here are few steps to improve  overall quality of our code base
We need to be  clear on  the requirements  and HLD/LLD design before start writing code .We need to document it at respective places wherever possible .
Does code do what it intends to do as per requirement.
Code should be modular and easy to read .
Proper commenting at necessary places Ex . While defining new class/function /design
Code should follow the best practises in coding style for respective language.
Code should be written in a way that it can be tested properly for various cases both manual and  automated .
Below  testing has to be done at developer stage. Test cases has to be included wherever possible
The  purpose of code review is to make sure that the overall code health improves, minimise bugs and coach  developers on  Language, framework, or general software design principles
Comment can  be  both  educational and critical

In any conflict on a code review, the first step should always be for the developer and reviewer to try to come to consensus.If it don't work set up face to face meeting. Next stage will be to escalate for broader team discussion.
Comments on what and why(if relevant) you are doing . Must before defining new class/function /design .

The first step while assessing the code quality of the entire project is through a static code analysis tool. Use the tools (based on technology) such as SonarQube, NDepend, FxCop, TFS code analysis rules. There is a myth that static code analysis tools are only for managers..
To track the code review comments use the tools like Crucible, Bitbucket and TFS code review process.

This space captures Product Quality (QA) improvement efforts, metrics, findings, recommendations.
Here Master Branch will be running on Production.
Suppose we are developing a Feature “Feature A“, So developers will create a branch “feature_a“ & start working on it and when it get compeleted the code will be merged to “dev” branch.
Merging to “dev“ branch will trigger a pipeline & it will be deployed to dev environment.
After testing on dev environment, the respective code will be merged to “qa” branch by raising a pull request.
Merging to qa branch will deploy code to respective qa environment and QA will start testing on it.
If there is some bug fixes then the same process repeates as feature_a branch will still be there.
After QA Approval the code will be merged to master branch and the code gets deployed to Production environment after a Pull request.
Now we can delete feature_a branch if needed.
Suppose there is a bug on Production and needs to be fix ASAP.
After the compeletion of the same the code will be merged to master branch after a pull request.

Purpose : To fetch data from redis instead of database.
Assumption:  Data  fetched from redis will be faster as compared to data fetched from database.

Overview:  An  API  is created that will fetch data from redis first,if the data is null then the data will be fetched from the database and it will be inserted into redis. It takes very less time to fetch and update data from redis as compared to databases.

When a user will send the request to fetch data ,then first backend will check if the data is present in redis or not , if the data is present in redis  then the data will be returned to the backend and the same data will be returned to the user too and if the data is not present in redis then it will return “null” and backend will fetch data from Database  and the same data will be added to redis and  will be returned to the user too.
If a user try to update any data present in the database it should be updated in redis and in the database as well.

"profile": "The X Factor is a television music competition franchise created by British producer Simon Cowell and his company SYCOtv. It originated in the United Kingdom, where it was devised as a replacement for Pop Idol (2001–2003), and has been adapted in various countries. The \"X Factor\" of the title refers to the undefinable \"something\" that makes for star quality.[1] The prize is usually a recording contract, in addition to the publicity that appearance in the later stages of the show itself generates, not only for the winner but also for other highly ranked contestants. Unlike Idols, where the judges only critique the contestants performances, on The X Factor each judge \"mentors\" the finalists in a particular category, aiding them with song selection and styling, while also participating together in judging the contestants in the other categories. Not only Idols, but also new singing shows such as The Voice and All Together Now have become rivals and popular in recent years.",

Whenever we change any Profile fields, we must log these events as part of the audit logging. These changes on the UI for any profile could be triggered from 3 points: Associate, Manager and Super-admin. We should have a common service which logs these changes from those 3 profile edit entry points.
At the moment we do have AuditObject which already logs some of the user updates on ELK.
We have to make sure that these new audit logs are permanent for future 3rd party/internal/external auditors for any security certifications etc
Supporting KPI reporting on the call usage etc => Adaption report
User edit audit logging => Profile audit logs
In 2.0.3 , we have made changes in cueing , user management , superadmin and  reporting. Their impacts are mentioned below as discussed in the Impact analysis meet on 29th November 2021 at 1:00 PM .

Our cueing project is not as stable as of now. Apparently , the issue is that after creating threads on the server , our cueing engine is not destroying those threads , which is leading to bottleneck in system resources.

Due to this we need to rewrite some of the code to fix the aforementioned problem, we’ll probably need to break cueing service in 2 parts , 1st will receive the snippet , and the other will send cues. Other issues include:
Lack of testing for cueing as it is not reliably stable

Lack of monitoring for cues based on call Ids. We are storing cue and FAQ data in Kibana, but there is yet to be an official UI for that so the Support Team can also see what transcription and corresponding cues have been generated for any particular Call.
We don’t see the cue count in the task list anywhere in our App
We don’t have a cue adherence report that could specify how well the agent has followed the cues shown
ICICI Bank is a big customer , which is planned to go live by January 2022 , will use cueing as our main feature and we haven’t included a cueing revamp in 2.0.4 as well.
Will also need to link the cue count report with cues UI
We currently don’t have cueing for Conference Calls , which also needs to be added for Bulldog.
The user management feature on Superadmin had been completely moved to the Backend Project.
Need to add cue count in task list.
Need to add transcription report and cues report for each call.

We have changed the Calling UI , as we have migrated the dialer from Model to the Page itself. This will be new for customers and has not been tested on a large scale, or even for a single customer yet.
We have now provided a default Disposition page after each call. Here the issue is that some customers like White Hat Junior , won’t need it.

We didn’t do anything for conference call  this sprint, and that is an urgent requirement from Bulldog. So now it will probably be done on the fly without any documentation and proper JIRA task , which could be a failure in sprint planning.
We have changed the source of associate reports , so now instead of PostgreSQL ,the reports are coming from Elasticsearch. This could lead to inconsistency in  data and functionality like :
There could be a data mismatch between Manager / Superadmin and Associate Reports as the data source of  Manager and Superadmin is still PostgreSQL.
Snippet search works on Associate report , but not in Manager reports
Some extremely important things that we can do to increase the performance and quality of our release are :
We can integrate with Auth0 again , so that session data is not hampered when we do deployment during production hours in order to provide hotfixes.
Reanalyze button which was developed back in 2.0.2 is not integrated in this release. We need to plan adding it to our next sprint

We need to create and alternative to Comm, which will fix the call log issues we are facing in production, these are likely to be fixed in release 2.0.4 as we are rewriting the CDR import project for Twilio and Plivo
Our Cloud ASR Engine won’t work in ICICI , so we need to plan that as well.

Unlike lead qualification, it is sufficient if the sales rep discovers atleast one or some of the needs of the client.

Correct need identification helps sales reps correctly map the right product out of a bouquet of products/ product features out of a set of features / solutioning for the right need.  In advanced versions of the product, we will build a feature need mapping and propose to have product recommendations for the right need, once the data science on need discovery model is more accurate. Feature to need mapping could be a many to many model, and the focus should be on ordering needs and applicable feature sets in a priority.

Need discovery calls also have an additional dimension of time.  Understanding customers need or pain point early on in a sales call is a critical factor in closing sales.  Asking good discovery questions early on in the call helps sales reps contextualise the solution with respect to the customers problems/ requirements.
Sub Signals : Need discovery questions are linked to either
Customer pain point - too much manual intervention (solution is saas), lack of personal attention (1:1 tutoring), managing risk (mutual funds), vulnerability (insurance),
In edtech, “Does your child get personal attention in class?” “Does your child follow everything in the classroom?”
In insurance, “Are you the only earning member in your family?”
Some other examples of generic examples of need discovery questions:
What is your boss or team hoping to accomplish in the next year?
How do your team’s objectives play into your department's strategy?
What do you perceive as your team’s greatest strength? Weakness?
From your perspective, what do you perceive your needs to be? How important are they?
How does your company evaluate the potential of new products or services?
Who has your business now? Why did you choose that vendor?
What are your buying criteria and success criteria?
Where would you put the emphasis regarding price, quality, and service?
What level of service are you looking for?
What do you like best about your present supplier? What don't you like?
What do you look for in the companies you do business with?
What do you like best about your current system? What would you like to see changed?
Would you rather cut costs, save money, or increase productivity?
Identifying customer pain point is a critical component of selling. What customer pain points does your product solve?
What questions should you ask to discover this pain point?

It is important for the sales rep to be exhaustive in the qualification.

Typically, industry best practices around lead qualification follow practises such as BANT (Budget, Authority, Needs, Timeline), CHAMP (Challenges, Authority, Money, Priority), MEDDIC (Metrics (RoI), Economic Buyer, Decision Criteria, Decision Process, Pain Point Identification, Champion).

For Salesken, we do not include these elements under Lead Qualification as each of those criteria are being evaluated independently under separate heads with separate business and data science logic.   For Salesken, we define Lead Qualification primarily around:
In insurance, classic qualifying questions are around premium determination - Are you a smoker? How old are you?
In Saas, for salesken, qualifying questions are “Do you use a CRM? Which CRM do you use currently? Which dialer do you use currently?'
For Edtech, qualifying questions could be “What grade is your child in? Does your child go to tuitions currently?”
For logistics, lead qualification could be “How many bedrooms are in your current house? Could you list the things you wish to move? What is the location of the places you’d wish to move?”
For home interior design, lead qualification could be “Is this your first house or second home?” “Is this an investment home?”
For construction, lead qualification could be “Whats the size of the pool? What materials are currently being used?”
Do you qualifiy your lead on the calls?
Which course do you want to pick after 12th standard?
"Your lead qualification process is currently operating at X%.”

Connections are the crux of human bonding.  Its a moment of zing…when there is a shared emotion - joy, laughter, pain, understanding. Human beings long for lasting connections.  This is the crux and the starting point of any good sales interaction.  Rapport building is core to establish a “common point” and “connect” outside of the sales conversation.  It is ideally done before the sales pitch begins but can be done during the call as well.  Rapport building in salesken is defined in a personal context 1:1 with the buyer, outside of the sales script.
Rapport building can happen over anything outside of the sales pitch.  A few common rapport building areas:
A rule for rapport building is to not get over friendly or over personal.
I read your blog on. Great article
What's going on in your business these days?
Do you have any exciting plans for the weekend (last weekend, coming up, and so forth)?
Is it true what they say about living in [city/state]?

I have such good memories of [city/state] — I visited when I was X years old and absolutely loved [destination/feature]. What do you think about [destination/feature]?
If I had the opportunity to pass through [city/state], what would be your top recommendations?
Is [city/state] a good location for [customer's industry/company/profession]?
I've heard [nearby restaurant/city/state] has amazing [food item]. Does it deserve the hype?

Skilled sales reps create a sense of urgency in potential customers. Without a deadline or time limit for buying your product or service, prospects will often spend time evaluating its pros and cons without making a decision and the sale can be stuck in a limbo.  A limbo is the true death knell of a prospect.  Death of a sales lead is rarely with a bang, mostly in quiet unresponsive whimpers.  A lead open for long can bring up competitor’s, bad reviews etc. An emotion of desire or need created in a sales call has a life…that emotion starts to fade with time and it is a crucial component of a sales process to create urgency to a purchase decision.

Fear - scarcity ie FOMO.  The fear of missing out (FOMO) is a highly effective technique to create a big sense of urgency. By telling the prospect how many products are left in stock at this moment, or how many spots are left at your exclusive event, you can use FOMO to your advantage.
20% discount on the price or a bonus when they buy within the next two hours
Only so many products are left in stock
Card: x% of your calls created urgency with the buyer for the purchase.
Text “Urgency is a critical part of the sales equation. Most sales leads die due to lack of urgency - delay, stalled - the world often ends not with a bang but with a whimper.”
Formula: Define Urgency as low/ medium/ high
Low: No instance of urgency found (for example, if some one said great 5 times, that is 5 instances and 1 match. Unlike other signals, an instance will suffice for this formula).

One of the core problems with most sales reps is the rush to start talking about product features.  Sales could be sold on

At Salesken, we have found that a sales pitch based on the product and its features, without emphasis on the buyers needs is a recipe for failure.  A sales pitch largely focused on the product does not connect to the customer.  The reason why  large number of sales reps rely on the less sophisticated product selling is:

Such methods of engagement do not create sufficient buyer engagement as the customer becomes passive in the conversation, rarely talking only listening.  There is a strong correlation between buyer engagement, buyer conversation/ responses/ talk time and sales stickiness.  To improve buyer engagement and resonance with the conversation, consultative selling has emerged as the better, more sophisticated way of selling.

It is important to engage the customer in his context.  Consultative selling is a great way to engage the customers.  Control over the conversation is harder to achieve in the conversational method of selling.  However, it has the great benefit of buyer engagement and buyer relaying his business/ need context.  The chemistry of the conversations can be built upon a lot more in a typical fashion as below:
Reference other pain/ need contexts for other similar buyers
Sell the problem back to the buyer and become the “knowledge expert of the problem”
Once buyer and rep are on the same “problem club”, become the knowledge expert of the solution - a new and amazing clever way to solve the problem
Shift gears from “sales person looking at the buyer as a wallet” to “knowledge leader who is seeking to help and enable success for the buyer”
Sell the product features as a solution to the buyers problem
Use buyer context (gained during need discovery) repeatedly during the product explanation
Talk pricing - by the time the pricing discussion is had, buyer and rep need to be completely on same page for the problem and the solution
Find out buyer’s organisational/ personal goals (need discovery 2)
Find out decision making process for the purchase decision (need discovery 3)

Change buyer into the champion (paint the vision for how buyer championing will provide strong organisation wins and help the buyer achieve goals, if b2b, else focus on buyers goals being acheived with purchase of the solution.  Sell the buyers goals back to him/her.)
Agree on next steps to engage other decision makers, if there are any.
Check rep question intensity: how many questions are being asked by the rep per call.  Who/where/what/how/for whom etc

A good closing is important as it connects the dots between sales calls.  A sales rep may cover all other dimensions of the playbook well, but if he forgets the closing aspects of the playbook, the lead has high potential to die.  The goal of a good closing is to ensure that next steps for the call are clearly defined and the call ends on a positive note.

A good opening sets the stage for the sales call.  For sales calls, time is a crucial dimension as there is a finite amount of time to make an impression on the customer and the words spoken early make a significant impact in how the customer perceives the experience.  Credentialing, positivity and high energy are the most important traits of a good opening.

Opening is best calculated only for first meaningful calls.  So tag all calls as first calls or follow up calls. Do not include follow up calls in opening calculations as the sales rep may not repeat all aspects of credentialing during follow up calls and is likely to only introduce himself second time over in brief
Sub-signals : Typical opening sub signals are
I am <name>, <designation such as Academic Counsellor/ relationship manager/ designer>
I am calling from the Relationship banking department
For your information, this call is being recorded
Do you want to check the lead source for the customer?
You had enquired on our website and left your contact details
Facebook, linkedin, social media, google, friend etc
Data collection for opening will be done during the onboarding wizard/ questionnaire
X% of your calls had a great opening.
Text: A great opening sets the right tone for a sales call.  100-X% of your calls did not greet the customer sufficiently or credential themselves or the organization well.
If coverage is over 90%, mark call as “Good opening”, else mark call as “Incomplete opening”.
Calculate coverage % for each subsignal as high medium low
High can be >50%, medium is 25-50%, low is less than 25% coverage for a signal
Greeting % =  No of meaningful first calls where Greeting subsignal was present / Total No of meaningful calls
Self Credentialing = No of meaningful first calls where Self credentialing subsignal was present / Total No of meaningful calls
Company Credentialing = No of meaningful first calls where Company credentialing subsignal was present / Total No of meaningful calls
Lead source = No of meaningful first calls where lead source subsignal was present / Total No of meaningful calls

Aircall is a dialer where we can make or receive calls. Aircall will store the details of the calls. A Scheduler will be invoked for every 30 minutes. Using API we will fetch call details of given time limits/range. Then it will send the call details as a response to the user.

The first scenario is the Basic Authorization. In this scenario, the user will select Aircall Dialer from the Sales Manager Web Application. After selection of Aircall dialer a window will open, where the user will enter the credentials like api_id and api_token. After getting details api_id and api_token will be concatenated with : and then resulted string is encoded using Base64. Then we will send a request to the Aircall for Authorization using encoded string using below format. After successful authorization entry gets created in cdr_provider table. And also set is_active status to true in cdr_provider table.
Request : https://api.aircall.io/v1/ping \ -H "Authorization: Basic {YOUR_ENCODED_STRING}"

In this scenario a Scheduler will be invoked for every 30 minutes. Then using API we will fetch the call details from the Aircall of a given time range. Aircall will send a call details as a string or object as a response.

Cron job is created on google scheduler. There will be two task, one is for creating cloud task and another one is to delete a cloud task. Scheduler will invoke for every 30 minutes. Based on this we will schedule a cron job on google cloud scheduler. The scheduler will call for an API to retrieve the   call details from the dialer with some time range/limit. Then dialer will fetch all call details of given time range. Then it will send all call details as a response.

After calling API to retrieve the call details from dialer, dialer will send all call details as response. Call Transformer is used to transforms the call details we get from the Aircall dialer API into the Salesken Call Objects. The sample schema for the Salesken Call object is given below.
Mapping of Aircall Entity and Salesken Call Object
The fields from the Aircall response entity are mapped into the Salesken call object as follows:-
Media server is used for converting a call recording file to WAV file. After converting it will returns the wav file and also it will be uploaded to Google Cloud bucket.

If user doesn’t want to use Aircall as a dialer then he can uninstall the Aircall dialer from Sales Manager Web Application by clicking on Aircall dialer and uninstall it. After uninstallation cdr_provider table will be updated as Aircall is_active status set to false. After successful uninstallation all cloud task related to Aircall dialer should be deleted.

When the user selects Aircall dialer from the  Sales Manager Web Application, he will provide us the credentials i.e api_id and api_token. After getting the details api_id and api_token is concatenated using : and then resulted string will be encoded using base64. Then using this encoded string we will send a request for authorization. If data gets stored successfully API response will be HTTP 200 else it will throw an exception.

Once a call is made by the agent or the user the call details will be stored in Aircall. Then there will be one scheduler that invokes for every 30 minutes. Then using api we will send a request to retrieve all call details of a given time range/limit. Then Aircall will retrieve all call details and send it as a response. Then that call details will be stored into the Salesken DB.

Once we get call recording then we have convert a audio file into WAV file. We will convert audio file into wav file using media server. Once we get audio file then we have to send a request to a media server. Then media server will convert the audio file to wav file and returns the audio file. And also audio will uploaded to Google cloud bucket. In the request we will send the method, url, uuid, bucketName and webhookUrl. In the url we will send the audio file link which is to be converted into WAV file. In uuid field we will send the callid. In the request we will also provide the bucket name of the Google cloud where the task will be stored. webhookUrl is used to update the call object after audio file is converted.

Here is the approach document for Salesken + Salesforce Integration for Oct-Nov 2021:
Select icon of Salesforce crm on salesken application
Users put the credentials of Salesforce for login.
Once we get the access token we just save and update it into the crm_integration table.
For authentication we hit Salesforce access token api.
Make a GET request to the URL below to get the Access Code.
After running this URL, you will be redirected to a redirect url with  an auth code appended in the url. Copy auth code from the redirect url and create a new URL as shown below.
Make a POST request with this url. This will give access token, refresh token and instance url.
Instance URL will be used at the start of every url used to make requests to api.
Make a POST request for refreshing the access token.
After successful authentication and authorization, we can query the Salesforce CRM for required objects. Add Authorization Header as Bearer access_token in all the requests.
Get a list of all the salesforce objects
Identify the fields which contain the relevant CDR data and write SOQL (Salesforce Object Query Language) to fetch it.
Fetch access_token from crm_integration schema based on company_id.
Validate access_token. If it is expired renew for the new access_token with the help of refresh_token.
In the service layer our service will hit the Salesforce search api to get the lead details whose email is same as the email we get in DTO.

After getting lead details and corresponding to the lead details our service will hit the Salesforce contact api based on lead_id for getting association of leads and deals where our lead is similar to contact of Salesforce.
Our service will hit the Salesforce deal api for deal details for each deal on the basic of deal_id and applying some filter.
At last we map the response we get form Salesforce to the SearchLeadResponse .

CloudTalk is a dialer where we can make or receive calls. This dialer stores all the call details made from its platform. We will fetch the call details using the CloudTalk API which will invoke every 30 minutes and store the call details in the Salesken database.

In this scenario, a Scheduler will be invoked every 30 minutes. Then using API we will fetch the call details from the CloudTalk of a given time range. CloudTalk will send call details as a string or object as a response.

Cron Job is created on google scheduler. There will be two tasks, one is for creating a cloud task and another one is to delete a cloud task. The scheduler will invoke for every 30 minutes. Based on this we will schedule a Cron Job on google cloud scheduler. The scheduler will call for an API to retrieve the call details from the dialer with some time range/limit. Then dialer will fetch all call details of the given time range.
Call transformer transforms the calls we get from CloudTalk's APIs into Salesken Call Objects. The sample schema for the Salesken Call object is given below.
We have a user name and password through which we log in.
After logging into cloud talk,  the ‘Dashboard’ page will open.
Steps to see the API’s : Go to Account>Settings>API KEYS
The below API is used to fetch all the call detail records for a particular organization.
Cloud talk API request consists of access key_id and access secret key. Now with the help of base 64 encodings, we are generating a basic auth key
The below API is used to fetch the call detail records within a specific date and time range.
The media server is used for converting a call recording file to WAV file. After converting it will return the wav file and also it will be uploaded to the Google Cloud bucket.

If the user doesn’t want to use the cloud talk as a dialer then he can uninstall the cloud talk dialer from the Sales Manager Web Application by clicking on the cloud talk dialer and uninstall it. After uninstallation cdr_provider table will be updated as the cloud talk is_active status is set to false. After successful uninstallation, all cloud tasks related to the cloud talk dialer should be deleted.

When the user selects the cloud talk dialer from the  Sales Manager Web Application, he will provide us the credentials i.e api_id and api_token. After getting the details api_id and api_token are concatenated using: and the resulted string will be encoded using base64. Then using this encoded string we will send a request for authorization. If data gets stored successfully API response will be HTTP 200 else it will throw an exception.

Once a call is made by the agent or the user the call details will be stored in Cloud talk. Then there will be one scheduler that invokes for every 30 minutes. Then using API we will send a request to retrieve all call details of a given time range/limit. Then Cloud talk will retrieve all call details and send them as a response. Then that call details will be stored in the Salesken database.

In this scenario, a Scheduler will be invoked every 30 minutes. Then using API we will fetch the call details from the RingCentral of a given time range. RingCentral will send call details as a string or object as a response.

Cron Job is created on google scheduler. There will be two tasks, one is for creating a cloud task and another one is to delete a cloud task. The scheduler will invoke for every 30 minutes. Based on this we will schedule a Cron  Job on google cloud scheduler. The scheduler will call for an API to retrieve the call details from the dialer with some time range/limit. Then dialer will fetch all call details of the given time range.
