8X8 is a dialer where we can make or receive calls. 8X8 will store the details of the calls. A Scheduler will be invoked every 30 minutes. Using API we will fetch call details of given time limits/range. Then it will send the call details as a response to the user.

The first scenario is the Basic Authorization. In this scenario, the user will select 8X8 Dialer from the Sales Manager Web Application. After the selection of the 8X8 dialer, a window will open, where the user will enter the credentials like api_id and api_token. After getting details api_id and api_token will be concatenated with: and then resulted in the string is encoded using Base64. Then we will send a request to the 8x8 dialer for Authorization using encoded string using the below format. After successful authorization entry gets created in cdr_provider table.

In this scenario, a Scheduler will be invoked every 30 minutes. Then using API we will fetch the call details from the 8x8 of a given time range. 8x8 will send call details as a string or object as a response.

The cron job is created on google scheduler. There will be two tasks, one is for creating a cloud task and another one is to delete a cloud task. The scheduler will invoke for every 30 minutes. Based on this we will schedule a cron job on google cloud scheduler. The scheduler will call for an API to retrieve the call details from the dialer with some time range/limit. Then dialer will fetch all call details of the given time range. Then it will send all call details as a response.

After calling API to retrieve the call details from dialer, the dialer will send all call details as a response. Call Transformer is used to transform the call details we get from the 8x8 dialer API into the Salesken Call Objects. The sample schema for the Salesken Call object is given below.
The media server is used for converting a call recording file to a WAV file. After converting it will return the WAV file and also it will be uploaded to the Google Cloud bucket.

If the user doesn’t want to use 8x8 as a dialer then he can uninstall the 8x8 dialer from the Sales Manager Web Application by clicking on the 8x8 dialer and uninstalling it. After uninstallation cdr_provider table will be updated as 8x8 is_active status set to false. After successful uninstallation, all cloud tasks related to the 8x8 dialer should be deleted.

When the user selects the 8x8 dialer from the  Sales Manager Web Application, he will provide us the credentials i.e api_id and api_token. After getting the details api_id and api_token are concatenated using: and the resulted string will be encoded using base64. Then using this encoded string we will send a request for authorization. If data gets stored successfully API response will be HTTP 200 else it will throw an exception.

Once a call is made by the agent or the user the call details will be stored in 8x8. Then there will be one scheduler that invokes for every 30 minutes. Then using API we will send a request to retrieve all call details of a given time range/limit. Then 8x8 will retrieve all call details and send them as a response. Then that call details will be stored in the Salesken database.

So the interpretation of Salesken Call Object for an inbound call scenario is that:
The leg1Number is the customer calling in and so this should be the number of the Salesken Lead who called the Salesken User

This is the data flow diagram of this integration.
“Id”: String :-    This id will be the random id.
“request_body” : String   :-  The request body contains the data to be sent using the request_url to fetch        some details.
“request_url”: String   :- This request_url contains the api on which the data will be fetched or posted using GET or POST methods. This request_url contains the request_body as params.
“response_code”: String   :-   Response code contains the result of the request we have sent. The code will be one of these : (200,400,401,500).
“response_body”: String   :-  Response body contains the response code, response message and also some details about call details.
“company_id”: String  :-  This Company_id will be the id of the company (ex: aircall)
“created_at” : Date :- Creation date of the ELK index. It will be the system time.
“eventName” : String :- This field will contains event names such as cdrfetch, cdrtransform, mediahandling, usercheck, crmdealcheck, callcreated, playbook.
“cdrProviderId“ : String :- This field will contains id of the provider.
“exception_message” : String  :- This field will contain the exception message which is thrown during the process.
“exception_code” : String  :- This field will contain the exception code which is thrown during the process. Some exception codes are 401,400,500.
“call_uuid”: String  :-  This field will contain the caller id.
“call_started_time”: String :- This field will contain the starting time of the call or time when the call is started.
“call_ended_time”: String :- This field will contain the time of the call when it is ended.
“call_duration”: String :- This field will contain the total duration of the call.
“leg_1_number”: String  :- This field will contain the phone number of the agent.
“leg_2_number”: String  :-  This field will contain the phone number of the customer.
“user_email”: String   :- This field will contain the email address of the user.
“call_status”: String   :- This field will contain the status of the phone call. Some call_status are missed, transferred, answered, ended.
“Provider_name”: String  :- This field will contain the name of the Provider.

Configure the twiMl app’s request url - Needs to https and return xml to handle the call.
Token generation with Account SID, API Key and API secret
Account SID, API Key and API Secret are taken from company_config entries using the logged in user’s company id from the postgres database (staging -> salesken_v2_1).
Grant is basically a list of permission token grant’s to the user, it can be conversation, calling, sms, or video.
Token is built using twilio’ s helper library : AccessToken then converted to jwt format.

String acctSid = "YOUR ACCOUNT SID";String applicationSid = "YOUR APP SID";String apiKey = "API KEY";String apiSecret = "API SECRET KEY";// Create Voice grantVoiceGrant grant = new VoiceGrant();grant.setOutgoingApplicationSid(applicationSid);      // Optional: add to allow incoming callsgrant.setIncomingAllow(true);        // Create access tokenAccessToken accessToken = new AccessToken.Builder(acctSid, apiKey, apiSecret)                .identity(identity)                .grant(grant)                .build();
.identity(identity)
.grant(grant)
.build();
More Info on Twilio’s Access Token - ​https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/access-tokens

A response xml is generated to tell the twilio.device. “CallerID” is basically from which the user receives the call. CallerID needs to be verified by twilio. “TO” is basically the number to which a call is made.
To record we need to pass a verb record in <Dail> in xml, which states which type of recording user wants to enable.
Currently we are using the “record-from-ringing-dual” option in <Dial> element which essentially allows dual channel recording from the moment ringing starts.
We can get several parameters from the twilio request object sent from Twilio server to our application-
“Caller” - We can get userId from this parameter by splitting based on : (colon).
“To” - We can get the dialed number from this parameter.
“CallSid” - We can get Twilio Call SID from this parameter which is used for making salesken_cdr entries in the postgres database (staging -> salesken_v2_1).
While making CDR entry to the database we are storing CallSid, provider, owner, client detail, call type and created time. If CallSid starts with “CA” then we store “Twilio” in the provider.
Once FE get’s token, Twilio.Device can be initiated.
To make an outgoing call Twilio.Device.Connect is called, providing an object with a phone number, taken by the user via an input.
The number entered  is validated using regex /^\+?[1-9]\d{11,14}$/
If the number is invalid, an error message is shown.
After connect is called, the request url defined in the twiMl app is hit by twilio which has an xml response and tells twilio what needs to be done.
After the call is initiated, events are provided by the twilio on Twilio Call instance to handle cases like :
Endpoint configured to xml app, which will have - username & password
Configure the xml app answer url - Needs to https and return xml to handle the call.
Plivo Endpoints - username and password are fetched from company_config entries using the logged in user’s company id from the postgres database (staging -> salesken_v2_1).
A rest controller which returns a xml type response <Response> element which has a <Dial> and <Number> element. <Dial> element has a callerId (From Number), and the <Number> element has To Number.
We can get several parameters from the plivo request object sent from Plivo server to our application-
“X-PH-userId” - We can get userId from this parameter.
“CallUUID” - We can get Plivo Call SID from this parameter which is used for making CDR entries in the database.
“CallStatus” - We can get call status from this parameter. We are making a CDR entry when the call status is “completed”.

While making CDR entry to the database we are storing CallSid, provider, owner, client detail, call type and created time. If CallSid starts with “CA” then we store “Twilio” in the provider or else “Plivo”.
The <Record> element is used to turn recording on and recordingSession is passed true to record the whole session.
<Response> <Record recordSession="true" /> <Dial callerId="from"> <Number>To</Number> </Dial></Response>
To make an outgoing call a user needs to be logged in plivo using the username and password from the endpoint -  created using plivoBrowserSdk.client.login(username, password)
On successful updation of the callerId and to number call an outgoing call should be made using plivoBrowserSdk.client.call(to,extraHeaders).
NOTE : The extra headers passed to the above method follows certain rules:
Your field must start with an uppercase letter. Other characters must be in lowercase.
Header name can only contain alphanumeric characters(A-Z, a-z, 0-9)
Header name can have a maximum length of 24 characters
Header value may comprise of alphabets(A..Z, a..z), numerals(0-9), and '%' .
Header value should have a maximum length of 48 characters
After the call is initiated, multiple events are provided by the plivo on Plivo Client instance to handle cases like :
Receive the sent headers as request parameters on client side. The header name-value pairs that do not follow the above rules will not be sent by Plivo.
More info on Plivo Browser SDK -

The task activity will display all the details regarding the upcoming, recents and completed events.
The task activity displays three major things such as:
The data for the upcoming, recent and completed activities is fetched from the SalesKen staging database.
The upcoming activity shows all the events that are upcoming for today.
Api: /v1/task/upcoming/v1 is hit to fetch the data regarding the upcoming events.
ResponseCode : 200 (success), 400 (Bad Request) ,500 (Internal Server Error)
The user Id of a lead is used to fetch the data from the database for the respective lead.

To fetch the data regarding the recent events, from the staging database, we select task.id, task.disposition, task.name, pipeline_stage.name, task.status, deal.name, lead.contacts, task.deal_id, task.task_type is fetched from the the task table.
A left join is performed on the deal table where task.deal_id = ​http://deal.id  and the deal.status should not be deleted.
A left join is performed on the lead table where deal.lead_id = lead.id.
A left join is performed on the pipeline_stage table where task.stage_id = pipleline_stage.id.

The query is then parsed and the data is then iterated over using a hashmap of key and value type of string and string respectively. The data then is set to the respective field of the TASK class, where the task class demands the following properties such as id, startDate, endDate, updatedAt etc.
The recent activity shows all the recent events for today.
Api: /v1/task/recent/v1 is hit to fetch the data regarding recent events.
The user Id is used to fetch the data from the database, where the userId is equal to the rep.skenId.keyword.

To fetch the data regarding the recent events, from the staging database, we select task.name, task.direction, task.disposition, task.duration, lead.phoneNumber, task.status, task.id , lead.companyName from the activity_log_bulk_v16 for a particular userId.
First all the tasks with the given userId are fetched by using the QueryBuilders on the term “rep.skenId.keyword” with must on term “task.callStatus.keyword” is “COMPLETED”.
The completed activity shows all the completed activity for the lead.
Api: /v1/task/completed/v1 is hit to fetch the data regarding recent events.
The userId is used to fetch the data from the staging database.
To fetch the data regarding the completed task event, we use the task.skenId, task.createdAt, task.callStatus, lead.companyName,
This API returns the complete details of a task whose Id user have provided

API returns the complete details of a given taskId like agent name, customer name, customer email, customer phone number , pipeline stage  and coordinates of call along with signal data. Signal data  contains details like color , name and its plotting coordinates over x and y axis of signal for a given task / Call.
EndPoint:<hostname>:8080/api/task/completed/details/{task_id}  task_id  is path param , replace it with callId whose complete details user want to fetch
The userId is used to fetch the user details from the database which API gets from the JWT token.
Left join call with pipeline on attribute call.stage_id , deal with call on attribute call.deal_id ,lead with deal on attribute deal.lead_id and user with call on attribute call.owner
After left joining of above tables select below attribute from different tables
Query used to fetch complete details of the given task

Query : "select call.id, call.recording_url, call.owner as agent_id, u.\"name\" as agent_name,"+ " u.profile_image as agent_image, "+ " TO_CHAR( call.started_at, 'hh12:mi AM' ) as task_start_time, TO_CHAR( call.start_date, 'DD Mon' ) AS task_start_date, l.contact as scp_contact_details, ps.stage_name , call.duration from call left join deal on ​http://deal.id  = call.deal_id left join lead l on l.id = ​http://deal.id  "+ "left join pipeline_stage ps on ps.id = task.stage_id left join user u on ​http://u.id  = task.owner where task.id = "+ taskId + "";
Here taskId is a user provided callId whose details the user wants to fetch.
Above query is used to get details of customer and agents .
To get signal data and plotting coordinates of signal follow below steps
First get provider_call_id details from the call table and then use details to fetch data from s3 having bucketname dummyskensnippet. Parse response which we get from s3 and map into response.
Query used to get provider_call_id from call table :
select provider_call_id from call where id = " + taskId
This API shows the history of completed Call based on given callId.
This API shows the list of  call IDs which were a part of the deal and whose call Id is given by the user.
EndPoint: <hostname>:8080/task/completed/history/{task_id}  task_id  is path param , replace it with taskId whose history user want to fetch
The userId is used to fetch the user details from the database which the API will get from the JWT token.
First create a subquery which fetches deal_id from the call table where id must be equal to given callId.

After getting the result of the query formed in step 2 fetch all details of the call whose deal_id must be present in the result of step 2 subquery and order them in descending order with respect to the attribute id.
Query - select * from call c where c.deal_id in (select c2.deal_id from call  c2 where c2.id = " + taskId + ") and c.id not in (" + taskId + ") order by c.id desc
Post execution of query get callId of all calls which were in the result set of above query.
The forgot password activity provides the utility to reset the password by sending an OTP to reset the password.
To know which user needs to receive the OTP, we verify it using the email of the user.
To get the user we select the user from the user table where the given email matches the email in the salesken staging database.
The reset password activity provides the functionality to reset the password of a given user.
To reset the password for a user the email of the user is used.
To fetch the user from the database we select the user from the user table where the given email = email in the database and the auth_token  = auth_token in the database.
The change password activity provides the utility to change the password for the given user.
To change the password for a user, the userId is used, which is fetched from the USER class.

To fetch the user with the particular userId from the database, we select the user from the user table where the given userId = userId in the database and the password = encryptedOldPassword from the database.
Then the new password is updated in the user table where the id is equal to the given userId.
The update user activity provides the functionality to update the user.
To fetch the data for the user the user object is passed to the update user function.
The name and id of the user is used from the user object.
The user with the given id with the role of a sales_manager is fetched from the database.
If no sales_manager with the given id exists in the database then a new sales_manager is created else the old sales_manager data is updated in the database.
To upload the image, first the image is fetched from the response of the uploadFile.
To set the image for a particular user, the given userId is used. The image is then updated in the database by updating the profile_image of the user with the given userId in the database.
To fetch the Twilio token the userId is used which is passed to the getOrgIdFromUserId function.
The organization id is then fetched from the database from the organization_configuration table where the userId matches the given userId.

Overview: API authenticates whether  details provided by the user are valid or not  and returns an authentication token.
1 ) Email should be as per standard , it should follow the regex pattern :^[A-Z0-9._%+'-]+@[A-Z0-9.-]+\\.[A-Z0-9]{2,6}$
First API validates whether user provided email is as per standard and post that API will fetch userDetails using user provided email .It uses below  query to fetch user details:

Query : "SELECT user.ID,user.caller_id, user.email, user.is_active, user. PASSWORD, user.profile_image, user.name, user.mobile,   user.languages, ​http://company.id , company.name AS org_name,company.website FROM user JOIN company ON user.company_d = ​http://company.id    WHERE LOWER (user.email) "+ "= LOWER ('" + userEmail + "');
Here userEmail  is userEmail which user has provided
After getting details , API checks if the password provided by the user is the same which is stored into DB using md5 encryption.
After checking the password  API check the user role, whether the user has SALES_ASSOCIATE role or not .

Post checking roles, API fetch few properties from comapny_config table and set in user object . Query fetches property name like AppCallEnabled,ProxyCallEnabled, UploadManualAudio, IsDispositionSkipDisabled ,IsCustomDispositionEnabled, CustomDispositionUrl, CrmProvider.
After setting property in user object It saves data related to auth token in auth_token table if entry is out there , else it updates properties .
INSERT INTO auth_token (  jwt, user_id, is_active, device_id, client_id, created_at, deactivated_at,build_no) VALUES"+ " ( ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, now(), now(),?);
Here values are the following : token (which is UUID), userId,true, device from which user logged in , user name and last build number of application.
UPDATE auth_token set  is_active=true,build_no=? , created_at = now() WHERE id=?
Here Values to be updated are : build number if changed, id is logged in userId
At last, after successfully execution of all  above steps create a JWT token and return in response header.

API logs  out  user from logged in device it internally updates the fsm user token by using Salesken  delete fcm_token API whose  request mapping is “api/v1/notification/fcm_token/delete” and is of type POST. Salesken fcm_token delete API takes the Notification object as input which is formed by setting deviceId, fcm_token and userId.
Hostname of fcm_token API is set in db.properties with key NOTIFICATION_URL
Overview: API validates whether a phone number provided by the user is valid or not .
Along with validation API validate performs the below actions as well which are :
It checks whether the trial period of given user is expired or not
It checks whether a user is active or not
It checks whether the user  has a license  or not.
It checks whether  the company has a valid licence or not.
If all above requirements are met then API validates phone number and returns success. If the phone number is valid API will return success else it would return a bad request.
To check the trial period of a given user is expired or not , API uses below query
Query : select * from company_config oc where companyId in (select user.company_Id from user  where id= "+ userId + " and oc.property_name in('OrganizationStatus','ExpiryDate'))
In the above query get data from company_config  table which contains the value of attribute property name “OrganizationStatus , ExpiryDate” and where company id equals to logged in user company id .
To check whether a user is active or not API uses below query
Query : select * from user iu where is_active = true and id = " + userId;
In above query get user data where id equals to logged in user Id and its is_active attribute is true. If the size of the query resultset is more than 0 then it concludes that the user is active.
To check whether a user has a license or not API  uses below query
Query : select * from user_license ul where ul.user_id =" + userId;
In above query get data from table user_license where user_id  attributes equals to logged in user Id .If size of  query resultset is more than 0 then it concludes that user has license..
To check whether a company has a license or not API  uses below query
Query : select is_paid from license where company_id in (select company_id from \"user\" where id=" + userId+")";

First fetch logged in user company id and then check whether in table license has attribute is_paid as true. If the size of the query resultset is more than 0 then it concludes that the company has an active license.
Users can make a proxy call using this API if the user has the role of SALES_ASSOCIATE.

The API defined in SALESKEN-TWILIO_URL is of type post and takes a user object as input.

This page contains the conversations between the customer and the agent. This also contains 4 cards i.e., task time, signal caught, call duration, and talk ratio.
About this Page: It gives an idea about the task snippet page. Like particular card refers to which set of data.
Talk Ratio: This shows the time when a call/task is created.
Signal Caught: This gives the signals that are found during the conversation between agent and customer. There are two types of Signals found in a task: Semantic Signals and Emotion Signals.
Talk Ratio: It gives the ratio of the total count of snippets of Agent to the total count of snippets of Customer in a task. That is the percentage of time the agent spoke on the conversations.

Conversation Box: This shows the conversation messages of the agent and customer. This data is fetched from the Amazon S3 storage.
Timeline Box: This shows the time of performing subtasks in a task. these data are fetched from several calls from the Postgres database.
Goals in salesken is a certain gamification of what the managers expect their associates to accomplish.
Goals are conversational in nature. For instance manager A can assign associate A1 to do opening in 80% of all the conversations they are having.
These goals are visible to the manager on their dashboard. Associate A1 after performing a call receive a pop-up and the call details also shows that they have achieved proper opening in this call.

CRM is the synchronization of data between LeadSquared and Saleksen. There are 2 broad use cases:Reading leads/ deals from CRM to Salesken. Writing tasks performed on Salesken to the CRM and for both these use cases we provide flexibility to configure entity mapping from CRM to Salesken’s.
CRM Module will be used in four different journey's:

Journey 1: The first scenario is post-authorization. In this scenario, the user will select LeadSquared CRM from the salesken web application portal, after the selection of LeadSquared CRM a window will be open, where the user will enter credentials i.e. Access key, Secret key, Calls log API, Async API key. After getting the details we will send a request to the CRM module for post-authorization.
Journey 2: In this scenario, there are two cases when we will sync user details from CRM.
After successfully post-authorization, we will sync all user's details i.e. user id from CRM to salesken DB.
When a new user will create on salesken application.
Journey 3: In this scenario, when the user dials a number from the Salesken application, then the dialed number will be searched by CDR import which makes a request to the CRM module.

Journey 4: In this scenario, After the call end CDR import makes a request to the CRM module for post-call hook. The CRM post-call hook will be used to push tasks on CRM corresponding salesken task. Before pushing the task on CRM we have to check that the current company is subscribing task import feature or not. If not subscribing then we will not push task on CRM.
Architecture Diagram:      Post Authorization:

When the user selects LeadSquared CRM from the Salesken web application portal, he will provide us the credentials i.e Access key, Secret key, Calls log API, Async API key. After getting the details we will validate this data, then this data will be stored in the database with table name company and column name provider_details. if data get stored successfully API response will be HTTP 200 else it will throw an exception.

When the user dials a number from the Salesken application, then the dialed number will be searched by CDR import which makes a request to the CRM module, then CRM module will search the number using Lead Search API and return the response i.e LeadSearchResponse which consists of email, full name, company name, CRM deals. if the number is not found by Lead Search API then we will return.
User sync will be done on user email. We will send a request to CRM and store response details will be stored in the database with table name user and column name provider_details.

The CRM post-call hook will be used to push task on CRM corresponding salesken call object. Before pushing the task on CRM we have to check that the current company is enabled the task import feature or not. After getting a response from CRM, we will create an entry on elk index with the current call object response which we got from CRM with the index name crm_hook_log.
Elastic Index Model: We will create an elk index with the name crm_hook_log to store all CRM post-call logs.

Scheduler will call below API in every 30 min or as per scheduled

·   StartTime – Helps user to define From which date - time user want to fetch details.If user doesn’t pass any.

Code to be written inside the api to fetch data and store data into salesken database.

Purpose : Retrieve details of all completed calls from Plivo Platform within a given time range.
Assumption :API will retrieve details of all calls which are completed within a given time range.
Scheduler will call below API in every 30 min or as per schedule

Overview: Create an API that retrieves details of all completed calls from Plivo Platform within a given time range using Plivo API  and store all the details into Salesken DB  with entity name “PlivoCalls”.
Response Codes : 200 (success), 401 (Unauthorized), 400 (Bad Request), 500 (Internal Server Error)
API will take the below query parameter :
·        StartTime (optional) – Helps users to define From which date-time user wants to fetch details.
Default Value – Current time  -  30 min.
·        EndTime (optional) – Helps users to define Till which date-time user wants to fetch details.

·        Limit(Optional) – Helps users to define the number of records to be fetched . As Plivo API  supports retrieval of a maximum 20 records at once , if the user wants to retrieve less than 20 records  then user can pass that number in this query param but If user passes more than 20, query param values will be ignored and  only 20 records will be fetched.

·        Offset (Optional) – User can refer to it as a page number , as total number of records might be more than 20 and at max user can fetch 20 records , if we divide all records into chunks / buckets of 20 then each bucket represents offset  number, starting from 0.

Note : As Limit and Offset is dependent on each other , total_count in Plivo System must be greater than equal to (offset+1)*limit. example – If there are 19 records  for a given time range and user pass limit as 10 and offset as 0 then API will return data from 1 to 10 records and if user pass offset as 1 then it will retrieve data  from 11 to 19 . But if the user selects limit as 20 then for offset 0  API will retrieve all 19 records and for offset greater than  will return empty list / no record .
API Response – “Success” with status code 200. (For successful execution.)

Requirement 1 - New Account Addition( Small Business )
Manager logs in the product with a sign up page or login credential.
After the login is successful, a pop up comes to select a package and that they want
Trial Account - All the trial featured will only be available
Platinum - Select the billing period and forward to the payment gateway
Gold - Select the billing period and forward to the payment gateway
Silver - Select the billing period and forward to the payment gateway.
Managers will get a licence attached to their account.
Managers carry forward with other product related configurations.
Note:- All the package amount and billing period related discount will be pre-configured.
Requirement 2 - Account addition to existing licence
Sales managers when adding a new user will get a privilege to attach that user to a new licence.
Each sales associate/sales manager created through this portal needs to be mandatorily attached to a licence.
After trial period is over sales manager will get pop up to select the package and billing period
If still not selected, then they can’t use the product
Requirement 4 - New Account Addition( Big Business )
New account is added to the chargebee side according to the finalized contract.
Subscription and billing cycle is configured according to the finalized contract.
Email and all other details are also configured according to the finalized contract.
When a sales manager logs in he won’t be asked to select the package, they will be directly transferred to the product.
Note:- All modifications to these type of account has to be done on chargebee side by Salesken account manager.
Show all the features attached to the account depending upon the package attached.
